scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Old John of Gaunt, time-honour'd Lancaster,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Hast thou, according to thy oath and band,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Brought hither Henry Hereford thy bold son,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Here to make good the boisterous late appeal,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Which then our leisure would not let us hear,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Against the Duke of Norfolk, Thomas Mowbray?

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: I have, my liege.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Tell me, moreover, hast thou sounded him,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: If he appeal the duke on ancient malice;

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Or worthily, as a good subject should,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: On some known ground of treachery in him?

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: As near as I could sift him on that argument,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: On some apparent danger seen in him

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Aim'd at your highness, no inveterate malice.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Then call them to our presence; face to face,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And frowning brow to brow, ourselves will hear

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The accuser and the accused freely speak:

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: High-stomach'd are they both, and full of ire,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: In rage deaf as the sea, hasty as fire.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Many years of happy days befal

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: My gracious sovereign, my most loving liege!

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Each day still better other's happiness;

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Until the heavens, envying earth's good hap,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Add an immortal title to your crown!

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: We thank you both: yet one but flatters us,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: As well appeareth by the cause you come;

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Namely to appeal each other of high treason.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Cousin of Hereford, what dost thou object

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Against the Duke of Norfolk, Thomas Mowbray?

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: First, heaven be the record to my speech!

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: In the devotion of a subject's love,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Tendering the precious safety of my prince,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And free from other misbegotten hate,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Come I appellant to this princely presence.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Now, Thomas Mowbray, do I turn to thee,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And mark my greeting well; for what I speak

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: My body shall make good upon this earth,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Or my divine soul answer it in heaven.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Thou art a traitor and a miscreant,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Too good to be so and too bad to live,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Since the more fair and crystal is the sky,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: The uglier seem the clouds that in it fly.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Once more, the more to aggravate the note,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: With a foul traitor's name stuff I thy throat;

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And wish, so please my sovereign, ere I move,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: What my tongue speaks my right drawn sword may prove.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Let not my cold words here accuse my zeal:

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: 'Tis not the trial of a woman's war,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: The bitter clamour of two eager tongues,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Can arbitrate this cause betwixt us twain;

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: The blood is hot that must be cool'd for this:

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Yet can I not of such tame patience boast

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: As to be hush'd and nought at all to say:

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: First, the fair reverence of your highness curbs me

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: From giving reins and spurs to my free speech;

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Which else would post until it had return'd

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: These terms of treason doubled down his throat.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Setting aside his high blood's royalty,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: And let him be no kinsman to my liege,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: I do defy him, and I spit at him;

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Call him a slanderous coward and a villain:

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Which to maintain I would allow him odds,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: And meet him, were I tied to run afoot

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Even to the frozen ridges of the Alps,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Or any other ground inhabitable,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Where ever Englishman durst set his foot.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Mean time let this defend my loyalty,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: By all my hopes, most falsely doth he lie.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Pale trembling coward, there I throw my gage,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Disclaiming here the kindred of the king,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And lay aside my high blood's royalty,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Which fear, not reverence, makes thee to except.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: If guilty dread have left thee so much strength

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: As to take up mine honour's pawn, then stoop:

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: By that and all the rites of knighthood else,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Will I make good against thee, arm to arm,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: What I have spoke, or thou canst worse devise.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: I take it up; and by that sword I swear

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Which gently laid my knighthood on my shoulder,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: I'll answer thee in any fair degree,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Or chivalrous design of knightly trial:

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: And when I mount, alive may I not light,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: If I be traitor or unjustly fight!

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: What doth our cousin lay to Mowbray's charge?

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: It must be great that can inherit us

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: So much as of a thought of ill in him.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Look, what I speak, my life shall prove it true;

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: That Mowbray hath received eight thousand nobles

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: In name of lendings for your highness' soldiers,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: The which he hath detain'd for lewd employments,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Like a false traitor and injurious villain.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Besides I say and will in battle prove,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Or here or elsewhere to the furthest verge

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: That ever was survey'd by English eye,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: That all the treasons for these eighteen years

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Complotted and contrived in this land

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Fetch from false Mowbray their first head and spring.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Further I say and further will maintain

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Upon his bad life to make all this good,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: That he did plot the Duke of Gloucester's death,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Suggest his soon-believing adversaries,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And consequently, like a traitor coward,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Sluiced out his innocent soul through streams of blood:

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Which blood, like sacrificing Abel's, cries,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Even from the tongueless caverns of the earth,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: To me for justice and rough chastisement;

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And, by the glorious worth of my descent,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: This arm shall do it, or this life be spent.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: How high a pitch his resolution soars!

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Thomas of Norfolk, what say'st thou to this?

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: O, let my sovereign turn away his face

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: And bid his ears a little while be deaf,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Till I have told this slander of his blood,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: How God and good men hate so foul a liar.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Mowbray, impartial are our eyes and ears:

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Were he my brother, nay, my kingdom's heir,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: As he is but my father's brother's son,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Now, by my sceptre's awe, I make a vow,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Such neighbour nearness to our sacred blood

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Should nothing privilege him, nor partialize

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The unstooping firmness of my upright soul:

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: He is our subject, Mowbray; so art thou:

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Free speech and fearless I to thee allow.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Then, Bolingbroke, as low as to thy heart,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Through the false passage of thy throat, thou liest.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Three parts of that receipt I had for Calais

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Disbursed I duly to his highness' soldiers;

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: The other part reserved I by consent,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: For that my sovereign liege was in my debt

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Upon remainder of a dear account,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Since last I went to France to fetch his queen:

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Now swallow down that lie. For Gloucester's death,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: I slew him not; but to my own disgrace

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Neglected my sworn duty in that case.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: For you, my noble Lord of Lancaster,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: The honourable father to my foe

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Once did I lay an ambush for your life,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: A trespass that doth vex my grieved soul

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: But ere I last received the sacrament

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: I did confess it, and exactly begg'd

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Your grace's pardon, and I hope I had it.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: This is my fault: as for the rest appeall'd,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: It issues from the rancour of a villain,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: A recreant and most degenerate traitor

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Which in myself I boldly will defend;

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: And interchangeably hurl down my gage

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Upon this overweening traitor's foot,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: To prove myself a loyal gentleman

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Even in the best blood chamber'd in his bosom.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: In haste whereof, most heartily I pray

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Your highness to assign our trial day.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Wrath-kindled gentlemen, be ruled by me;

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Let's purge this choler without letting blood:

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: This we prescribe, though no physician;

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Deep malice makes too deep incision;

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Forget, forgive; conclude and be agreed;

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Our doctors say this is no month to bleed.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Good uncle, let this end where it begun;

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: We'll calm the Duke of Norfolk, you your son.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: To be a make-peace shall become my age:

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Throw down, my son, the Duke of Norfolk's gage.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And, Norfolk, throw down his.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: When, Harry, when?

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Obedience bids I should not bid again.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Norfolk, throw down, we bid; there is no boot.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Myself I throw, dread sovereign, at thy foot.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: My life thou shalt command, but not my shame:

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: The one my duty owes; but my fair name,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Despite of death that lives upon my grave,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: To dark dishonour's use thou shalt not have.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: I am disgraced, impeach'd and baffled here,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Pierced to the soul with slander's venom'd spear,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: The which no balm can cure but his heart-blood

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Which breathed this poison.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Rage must be withstood:

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Give me his gage: lions make leopards tame.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Yea, but not change his spots: take but my shame.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: And I resign my gage. My dear dear lord,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: The purest treasure mortal times afford

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Is spotless reputation: that away,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Men are but gilded loam or painted clay.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: A jewel in a ten-times-barr'd-up chest

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Is a bold spirit in a loyal breast.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Mine honour is my life; both grow in one:

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Take honour from me, and my life is done:

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Then, dear my liege, mine honour let me try;

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: In that I live and for that will I die.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Cousin, throw up your gage; do you begin.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: O, God defend my soul from such deep sin!

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Shall I seem crest-fall'n in my father's sight?

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Or with pale beggar-fear impeach my height

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Before this out-dared dastard? Ere my tongue

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Shall wound my honour with such feeble wrong,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Or sound so base a parle, my teeth shall tear

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: The slavish motive of recanting fear,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And spit it bleeding in his high disgrace,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Where shame doth harbour, even in Mowbray's face.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: We were not born to sue, but to command;

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Which since we cannot do to make you friends,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Be ready, as your lives shall answer it,

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: At Coventry, upon Saint Lambert's day:

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: There shall your swords and lances arbitrate

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The swelling difference of your settled hate:

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Since we can not atone you, we shall see

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Justice design the victor's chivalry.

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Lord marshal, command our officers at arms

scene: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Be ready to direct these home alarms.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Alas, the part I had in Woodstock's blood

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Doth more solicit me than your exclaims,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: To stir against the butchers of his life!

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: But since correction lieth in those hands

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Which made the fault that we cannot correct,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Put we our quarrel to the will of heaven;

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Who, when they see the hours ripe on earth,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Will rain hot vengeance on offenders' heads.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Finds brotherhood in thee no sharper spur?

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Hath love in thy old blood no living fire?

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Edward's seven sons, whereof thyself art one,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Were as seven vials of his sacred blood,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Or seven fair branches springing from one root:

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Some of those seven are dried by nature's course,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Some of those branches by the Destinies cut;

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: But Thomas, my dear lord, my life, my Gloucester,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: One vial full of Edward's sacred blood,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: One flourishing branch of his most royal root,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Is crack'd, and all the precious liquor spilt,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Is hack'd down, and his summer leaves all faded,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: By envy's hand and murder's bloody axe.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Ah, Gaunt, his blood was thine! that bed, that womb,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: That metal, that self-mould, that fashion'd thee

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Made him a man; and though thou livest and breathest,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Yet art thou slain in him: thou dost consent

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: In some large measure to thy father's death,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: In that thou seest thy wretched brother die,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Who was the model of thy father's life.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Call it not patience, Gaunt; it is despair:

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: In suffering thus thy brother to be slaughter'd,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Thou showest the naked pathway to thy life,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Teaching stern murder how to butcher thee:

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: That which in mean men we intitle patience

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Is pale cold cowardice in noble breasts.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: What shall I say? to safeguard thine own life,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: The best way is to venge my Gloucester's death.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: God's is the quarrel; for God's substitute,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: His deputy anointed in His sight,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Hath caused his death: the which if wrongfully,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Let heaven revenge; for I may never lift

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: An angry arm against His minister.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Where then, alas, may I complain myself?

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: To God, the widow's champion and defence.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Why, then, I will. Farewell, old Gaunt.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Thou goest to Coventry, there to behold

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Our cousin Hereford and fell Mowbray fight:

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: O, sit my husband's wrongs on Hereford's spear,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: That it may enter butcher Mowbray's breast!

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Or, if misfortune miss the first career,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Be Mowbray's sins so heavy in his bosom,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: They may break his foaming courser's back,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: And throw the rider headlong in the lists,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: A caitiff recreant to my cousin Hereford!

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Farewell, old Gaunt: thy sometimes brother's wife

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: With her companion grief must end her life.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Sister, farewell; I must to Coventry:

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: As much good stay with thee as go with me!

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Yet one word more: grief boundeth where it falls,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Not with the empty hollowness, but weight:

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: I take my leave before I have begun,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: For sorrow ends not when it seemeth done.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Commend me to thy brother, Edmund York.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Lo, this is all:--nay, yet depart not so;

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Though this be all, do not so quickly go;

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: I shall remember more. Bid him--ah, what?--

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: With all good speed at Plashy visit me.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Alack, and what shall good old York there see

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: But empty lodgings and unfurnish'd walls,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Unpeopled offices, untrodden stones?

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: And what hear there for welcome but my groans?

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Therefore commend me; let him not come there,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: To seek out sorrow that dwells every where.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: Desolate, desolate, will I hence and die:

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.
speaker: DUCHESS
line: The last leave of thee takes my weeping eye.

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: Lord Marshal
line: My Lord Aumerle, is Harry Hereford arm'd?

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Yea, at all points; and longs to enter in.

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: Lord Marshal
line: The Duke of Norfolk, sprightfully and bold,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: Lord Marshal
line: Stays but the summons of the appellant's trumpet.

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Why, then, the champions are prepared, and stay

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: For nothing but his majesty's approach.

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Marshal, demand of yonder champion

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The cause of his arrival here in arms:

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Ask him his name and orderly proceed

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To swear him in the justice of his cause.

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: Lord Marshal
line: In God's name and the king's, say who thou art

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: Lord Marshal
line: And why thou comest thus knightly clad in arms,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: Lord Marshal
line: Against what man thou comest, and what thy quarrel:

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: Lord Marshal
line: Speak truly, on thy knighthood and thy oath;

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: Lord Marshal
line: As so defend thee heaven and thy valour!

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: My name is Thomas Mowbray, Duke of Norfolk;

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Who hither come engaged by my oath--

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Which God defend a knight should violate!--

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Both to defend my loyalty and truth

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: To God, my king and my succeeding issue,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: Against the Duke of Hereford that appeals me

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: And, by the grace of God and this mine arm,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: To prove him, in defending of myself,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: A traitor to my God, my king, and me:

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY
line: And as I truly fight, defend me heaven!

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Marshal, ask yonder knight in arms,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Both who he is and why he cometh hither

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Thus plated in habiliments of war,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And formally, according to our law,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Depose him in the justice of his cause.

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: Lord Marshal
line: What is thy name? and wherefore comest thou hither,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: Lord Marshal
line: Before King Richard in his royal lists?

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: Lord Marshal
line: Against whom comest thou? and what's thy quarrel?

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: Lord Marshal
line: Speak like a true knight, so defend thee heaven!

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Harry of Hereford, Lancaster and Derby

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Am I; who ready here do stand in arms,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: To prove, by God's grace and my body's valour,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: In lists, on Thomas Mowbray, Duke of Norfolk,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: That he is a traitor, foul and dangerous,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: To God of heaven, King Richard and to me;

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And as I truly fight, defend me heaven!

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: Lord Marshal
line: On pain of death, no person be so bold

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: Lord Marshal
line: Or daring-hardy as to touch the lists,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: Lord Marshal
line: Except the marshal and such officers

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: Lord Marshal
line: Appointed to direct these fair designs.

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Lord marshal, let me kiss my sovereign's hand,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And bow my knee before his majesty:

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: For Mowbray and myself are like two men

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: That vow a long and weary pilgrimage;

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Then let us take a ceremonious leave

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And loving farewell of our several friends.

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: Lord Marshal
line: The appellant in all duty greets your highness,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: Lord Marshal
line: And craves to kiss your hand and take his leave.

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: We will descend and fold him in our arms.

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Cousin of Hereford, as thy cause is right,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: So be thy fortune in this royal fight!

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Farewell, my blood; which if to-day thou shed,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Lament we may, but not revenge thee dead.

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: O let no noble eye profane a tear

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: For me, if I be gored with Mowbray's spear:

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: As confident as is the falcon's flight

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Against a bird, do I with Mowbray fight.

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: My loving lord, I take my leave of you;

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Of you, my noble cousin, Lord Aumerle;

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Not sick, although I have to do with death,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: But lusty, young, and cheerly drawing breath.

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Lo, as at English feasts, so I regreet

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: The daintiest last, to make the end most sweet:

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: O thou, the earthly author of my blood,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Whose youthful spirit, in me regenerate,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Doth with a twofold vigour lift me up

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: To reach at victory above my head,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Add proof unto mine armour with thy prayers;

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And with thy blessings steel my lance's point,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: That it may enter Mowbray's waxen coat,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And furbish new the name of John a Gaunt,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Even in the lusty havior of his son.

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: God in thy good cause make thee prosperous!

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Be swift like lightning in the execution;

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: And let thy blows, doubly redoubled,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Fall like amazing thunder on the casque

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Of thy adverse pernicious enemy:

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Rouse up thy youthful blood, be valiant and live.

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Mine innocency and Saint George to thrive!

line: And thou art flying to a fresher clime:

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Look, what thy soul holds dear, imagine it

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: To lie that way thou go'st, not whence thou comest:

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Suppose the singing birds musicians,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: The grass whereon thou tread'st the presence strew'd,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: The flowers fair ladies, and thy steps no more

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Than a delightful measure or a dance;

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: For gnarling sorrow hath less power to bite

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: The man that mocks at it and sets it light.

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: O, who can hold a fire in his hand

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: By thinking on the frosty Caucasus?

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Or cloy the hungry edge of appetite

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: By bare imagination of a feast?

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Or wallow naked in December snow

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: By thinking on fantastic summer's heat?

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: O, no! the apprehension of the good

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Gives but the greater feeling to the worse:

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Fell sorrow's tooth doth never rankle more

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Than when he bites, but lanceth not the sore.

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Come, come, my son, I'll bring thee on thy way:

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Had I thy youth and cause, I would not stay.

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Then, England's ground, farewell; sweet soil, adieu;

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: My mother, and my nurse, that bears me yet!

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Where'er I wander, boast of this I can,

scene: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Though banish'd, yet a trueborn Englishman.

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: We did observe. Cousin Aumerle,

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: How far brought you high Hereford on his way?

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: I brought high Hereford, if you call him so,

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: But to the next highway, and there I left him.

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And say, what store of parting tears were shed?

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Faith, none for me; except the north-east wind,

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Which then blew bitterly against our faces,

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Awaked the sleeping rheum, and so by chance

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Did grace our hollow parting with a tear.

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: What said our cousin when you parted with him?

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: 'Farewell:'

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: And, for my heart disdained that my tongue

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Should so profane the word, that taught me craft

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: To counterfeit oppression of such grief

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: That words seem'd buried in my sorrow's grave.

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Marry, would the word 'farewell' have lengthen'd hours

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: And added years to his short banishment,

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: He should have had a volume of farewells;

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: But since it would not, he had none of me.

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: He is our cousin, cousin; but 'tis doubt,

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: When time shall call him home from banishment,

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Whether our kinsman come to see his friends.

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Ourself and Bushy, Bagot here and Green

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Observed his courtship to the common people;

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: How he did seem to dive into their hearts

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: With humble and familiar courtesy,

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: What reverence he did throw away on slaves,

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Wooing poor craftsmen with the craft of smiles

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And patient underbearing of his fortune,

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: As 'twere to banish their affects with him.

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Off goes his bonnet to an oyster-wench;

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: A brace of draymen bid God speed him well

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And had the tribute of his supple knee,

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: With 'Thanks, my countrymen, my loving friends;'

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: As were our England in reversion his,

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And he our subjects' next degree in hope.

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: GREEN
line: Well, he is gone; and with him go these thoughts.

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: GREEN
line: Now for the rebels which stand out in Ireland,

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: GREEN
line: Expedient manage must be made, my liege,

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: GREEN
line: Ere further leisure yield them further means

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: GREEN
line: For their advantage and your highness' loss.

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: We will ourself in person to this war:

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And, for our coffers, with too great a court

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And liberal largess, are grown somewhat light,

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: We are inforced to farm our royal realm;

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The revenue whereof shall furnish us

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: For our affairs in hand: if that come short,

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Our substitutes at home shall have blank charters;

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Whereto, when they shall know what men are rich,

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: They shall subscribe them for large sums of gold

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And send them after to supply our wants;

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: For we will make for Ireland presently.

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Bushy, what news?

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Old John of Gaunt is grievous sick, my lord,

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Suddenly taken; and hath sent post haste

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: BUSHY
line: To entreat your majesty to visit him.

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Where lies he?

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: BUSHY
line: At Ely House.

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Now put it, God, in the physician's mind

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To help him to his grave immediately!

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The lining of his coffers shall make coats

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To deck our soldiers for these Irish wars.

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Come, gentlemen, let's all go visit him:

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Pray God we may make haste, and come too late!

scene: SCENE IV.  The court.
speaker: All
line: Amen.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Will the king come, that I may breathe my last

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: In wholesome counsel to his unstaid youth?

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Vex not yourself, nor strive not with your breath;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: For all in vain comes counsel to his ear.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: O, but they say the tongues of dying men

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Enforce attention like deep harmony:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Where words are scarce, they are seldom spent in vain,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: For they breathe truth that breathe their words in pain.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: He that no more must say is listen'd more

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Than they whom youth and ease have taught to glose;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: More are men's ends mark'd than their lives before:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: The setting sun, and music at the close,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: As the last taste of sweets, is sweetest last,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Writ in remembrance more than things long past:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Though Richard my life's counsel would not hear,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: My death's sad tale may yet undeaf his ear.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: No; it is stopp'd with other flattering sounds,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: As praises, of whose taste the wise are fond,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Lascivious metres, to whose venom sound

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: The open ear of youth doth always listen;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Report of fashions in proud Italy,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Whose manners still our tardy apish nation

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Limps after in base imitation.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Where doth the world thrust forth a vanity--

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: So it be new, there's no respect how vile--

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: That is not quickly buzzed into his ears?

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Then all too late comes counsel to be heard,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Where will doth mutiny with wit's regard.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Direct not him whose way himself will choose:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: 'Tis breath thou lack'st, and that breath wilt thou lose.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Methinks I am a prophet new inspired

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: And thus expiring do foretell of him:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: His rash fierce blaze of riot cannot last,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: For violent fires soon burn out themselves;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Small showers last long, but sudden storms are short;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: He tires betimes that spurs too fast betimes;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: With eager feeding food doth choke the feeder:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Light vanity, insatiate cormorant,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Consuming means, soon preys upon itself.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: This royal throne of kings, this scepter'd isle,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: This earth of majesty, this seat of Mars,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: This other Eden, demi-paradise,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: This fortress built by Nature for herself

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Against infection and the hand of war,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: This happy breed of men, this little world,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: This precious stone set in the silver sea,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Which serves it in the office of a wall,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Or as a moat defensive to a house,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Against the envy of less happier lands,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: This blessed plot, this earth, this realm, this England,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: This nurse, this teeming womb of royal kings,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Fear'd by their breed and famous by their birth,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Renowned for their deeds as far from home,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: For Christian service and true chivalry,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: As is the sepulchre in stubborn Jewry,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Of the world's ransom, blessed Mary's Son,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: This land of such dear souls, this dear dear land,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Dear for her reputation through the world,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Is now leased out, I die pronouncing it,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Like to a tenement or pelting farm:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: England, bound in with the triumphant sea

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Whose rocky shore beats back the envious siege

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Of watery Neptune, is now bound in with shame,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: With inky blots and rotten parchment bonds:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: That England, that was wont to conquer others,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Hath made a shameful conquest of itself.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Ah, would the scandal vanish with my life,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: How happy then were my ensuing death!

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: The king is come: deal mildly with his youth;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: For young hot colts being raged do rage the more.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: QUEEN
line: How fares our noble uncle, Lancaster?

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: What comfort, man? how is't with aged Gaunt?

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: O how that name befits my composition!

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Old Gaunt indeed, and gaunt in being old:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Within me grief hath kept a tedious fast;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: And who abstains from meat that is not gaunt?

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: For sleeping England long time have I watch'd;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Watching breeds leanness, leanness is all gaunt:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: The pleasure that some fathers feed upon,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Is my strict fast; I mean, my children's looks;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: And therein fasting, hast thou made me gaunt:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Gaunt am I for the grave, gaunt as a grave,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Whose hollow womb inherits nought but bones.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Can sick men play so nicely with their names?

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: No, misery makes sport to mock itself:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Since thou dost seek to kill my name in me,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: I mock my name, great king, to flatter thee.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Should dying men flatter with those that live?

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: No, no, men living flatter those that die.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Thou, now a-dying, say'st thou flatterest me.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: O, no! thou diest, though I the sicker be.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: I am in health, I breathe, and see thee ill.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Now He that made me knows I see thee ill;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Ill in myself to see, and in thee seeing ill.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Thy death-bed is no lesser than thy land

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Wherein thou liest in reputation sick;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: And thou, too careless patient as thou art,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Commit'st thy anointed body to the cure

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Of those physicians that first wounded thee:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: A thousand flatterers sit within thy crown,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Whose compass is no bigger than thy head;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: And yet, incaged in so small a verge,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: The waste is no whit lesser than thy land.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: O, had thy grandsire with a prophet's eye

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Seen how his son's son should destroy his sons,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: From forth thy reach he would have laid thy shame,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Deposing thee before thou wert possess'd,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Which art possess'd now to depose thyself.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Why, cousin, wert thou regent of the world,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: It were a shame to let this land by lease;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: But for thy world enjoying but this land,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Is it not more than shame to shame it so?

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Landlord of England art thou now, not king:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Thy state of law is bondslave to the law; And thou--

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: A lunatic lean-witted fool,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Presuming on an ague's privilege,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Darest with thy frozen admonition

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Make pale our cheek, chasing the royal blood

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: With fury from his native residence.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Now, by my seat's right royal majesty,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Wert thou not brother to great Edward's son,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: This tongue that runs so roundly in thy head

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Should run thy head from thy unreverent shoulders.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: O, spare me not, my brother Edward's son,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: For that I was his father Edward's son;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: That blood already, like the pelican,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Hast thou tapp'd out and drunkenly caroused:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: My brother Gloucester, plain well-meaning soul,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Whom fair befal in heaven 'mongst happy souls!

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: May be a precedent and witness good

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: That thou respect'st not spilling Edward's blood:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Join with the present sickness that I have;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: And thy unkindness be like crooked age,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: To crop at once a too long wither'd flower.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Live in thy shame, but die not shame with thee!

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: These words hereafter thy tormentors be!

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Convey me to my bed, then to my grave:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: JOHN OF GAUNT
line: Love they to live that love and honour have.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And let them die that age and sullens have;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: For both hast thou, and both become the grave.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: I do beseech your majesty, impute his words

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: To wayward sickliness and age in him:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: He loves you, on my life, and holds you dear

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: As Harry Duke of Hereford, were he here.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Right, you say true: as Hereford's love, so his;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: As theirs, so mine; and all be as it is.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: My liege, old Gaunt commends him to your majesty.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: What says he?

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Nay, nothing; all is said

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: His tongue is now a stringless instrument;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Words, life and all, old Lancaster hath spent.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Be York the next that must be bankrupt so!

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Though death be poor, it ends a mortal woe.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The ripest fruit first falls, and so doth he;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: His time is spent, our pilgrimage must be.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: So much for that. Now for our Irish wars:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: We must supplant those rough rug-headed kerns,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Which live like venom where no venom else

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: But only they have privilege to live.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And for these great affairs do ask some charge,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Towards our assistance we do seize to us

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The plate, corn, revenues and moveables,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Whereof our uncle Gaunt did stand possess'd.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: How long shall I be patient? ah, how long

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Shall tender duty make me suffer wrong?

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Not Gloucester's death, nor Hereford's banishment

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Not Gaunt's rebukes, nor England's private wrongs,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Nor the prevention of poor Bolingbroke

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: About his marriage, nor my own disgrace,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Have ever made me sour my patient cheek,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Or bend one wrinkle on my sovereign's face.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: I am the last of noble Edward's sons,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Of whom thy father, Prince of Wales, was first:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: In war was never lion raged more fierce,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: In peace was never gentle lamb more mild,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Than was that young and princely gentleman.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: His face thou hast, for even so look'd he,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Accomplish'd with the number of thy hours;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: But when he frown'd, it was against the French

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: And not against his friends; his noble hand

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Did will what he did spend and spent not that

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Which his triumphant father's hand had won;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: His hands were guilty of no kindred blood,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: But bloody with the enemies of his kin.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: O Richard! York is too far gone with grief,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Or else he never would compare between.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Why, uncle, what's the matter?

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: O my liege,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Pardon me, if you please; if not, I, pleased

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Not to be pardon'd, am content withal.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Seek you to seize and gripe into your hands

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: The royalties and rights of banish'd Hereford?

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Is not Gaunt dead, and doth not Hereford live?

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Was not Gaunt just, and is not Harry true?

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Did not the one deserve to have an heir?

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Is not his heir a well-deserving son?

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Take Hereford's rights away, and take from Time

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: His charters and his customary rights;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Let not to-morrow then ensue to-day;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Be not thyself; for how art thou a king

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: But by fair sequence and succession?

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Now, afore God--God forbid I say true!--

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: If you do wrongfully seize Hereford's rights,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Call in the letters patent that he hath

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: By his attorneys-general to sue

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: His livery, and deny his offer'd homage,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: You pluck a thousand dangers on your head,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: You lose a thousand well-disposed hearts

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: And prick my tender patience, to those thoughts

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Which honour and allegiance cannot think.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Think what you will, we seize into our hands

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: His plate, his goods, his money and his lands.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: I'll not be by the while: my liege, farewell:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: What will ensue hereof, there's none can tell;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: But by bad courses may be understood

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: That their events can never fall out good.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Go, Bushy, to the Earl of Wiltshire straight:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Bid him repair to us to Ely House

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To see this business. To-morrow next

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: We will for Ireland; and 'tis time, I trow:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And we create, in absence of ourself,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Our uncle York lord governor of England;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: For he is just and always loved us well.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Come on, our queen: to-morrow must we part;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Be merry, for our time of stay is short

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Well, lords, the Duke of Lancaster is dead.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD ROSS
line: And living too; for now his son is duke.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD WILLOUGHBY
line: Barely in title, not in revenue.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Richly in both, if justice had her right.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD ROSS
line: My heart is great; but it must break with silence,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD ROSS
line: Ere't be disburden'd with a liberal tongue.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Nay, speak thy mind; and let him ne'er speak more

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: That speaks thy words again to do thee harm!

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD WILLOUGHBY
line: Tends that thou wouldst speak to the Duke of Hereford?

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD WILLOUGHBY
line: If it be so, out with it boldly, man;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD WILLOUGHBY
line: Quick is mine ear to hear of good towards him.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD ROSS
line: No good at all that I can do for him;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD ROSS
line: Unless you call it good to pity him,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD ROSS
line: Bereft and gelded of his patrimony.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Now, afore God, 'tis shame such wrongs are borne

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: In him, a royal prince, and many moe

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Of noble blood in this declining land.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: The king is not himself, but basely led

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: By flatterers; and what they will inform,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Merely in hate, 'gainst any of us all,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: That will the king severely prosecute

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: 'Gainst us, our lives, our children, and our heirs.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD ROSS
line: The commons hath he pill'd with grievous taxes,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD ROSS
line: And quite lost their hearts: the nobles hath he fined

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD ROSS
line: For ancient quarrels, and quite lost their hearts.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD WILLOUGHBY
line: And daily new exactions are devised,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD WILLOUGHBY
line: As blanks, benevolences, and I wot not what:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD WILLOUGHBY
line: But what, o' God's name, doth become of this?

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Wars have not wasted it, for warr'd he hath not,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: But basely yielded upon compromise

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: That which his noble ancestors achieved with blows:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: More hath he spent in peace than they in wars.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD ROSS
line: The Earl of Wiltshire hath the realm in farm.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD WILLOUGHBY
line: The king's grown bankrupt, like a broken man.
