scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Reproach and dissolution hangeth over him.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD ROSS
line: He hath not money for these Irish wars,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD ROSS
line: His burthenous taxations notwithstanding,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD ROSS
line: But by the robbing of the banish'd duke.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: His noble kinsman: most degenerate king!

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: But, lords, we hear this fearful tempest sing,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Yet see no shelter to avoid the storm;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: We see the wind sit sore upon our sails,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: And yet we strike not, but securely perish.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD ROSS
line: We see the very wreck that we must suffer;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD ROSS
line: And unavoided is the danger now,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD ROSS
line: For suffering so the causes of our wreck.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Not so; even through the hollow eyes of death

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: I spy life peering; but I dare not say

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: How near the tidings of our comfort is.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD WILLOUGHBY
line: Nay, let us share thy thoughts, as thou dost ours.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD ROSS
line: Be confident to speak, Northumberland:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD ROSS
line: We three are but thyself; and, speaking so,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD ROSS
line: Thy words are but as thoughts; therefore, be bold.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Then thus: I have from Port le Blanc, a bay

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: In Brittany, received intelligence

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: That Harry Duke of Hereford, Rainold Lord Cobham,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: That late broke from the Duke of Exeter,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: His brother, Archbishop late of Canterbury,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Sir Thomas Erpingham, Sir John Ramston,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Sir John Norbery, Sir Robert Waterton and Francis Quoint,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: All these well furnish'd by the Duke of Bretagne

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: With eight tall ships, three thousand men of war,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Are making hither with all due expedience

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: And shortly mean to touch our northern shore:

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Perhaps they had ere this, but that they stay

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: The first departing of the king for Ireland.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: If then we shall shake off our slavish yoke,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Imp out our drooping country's broken wing,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Redeem from broking pawn the blemish'd crown,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Wipe off the dust that hides our sceptre's gilt

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: And make high majesty look like itself,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Away with me in post to Ravenspurgh;

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: But if you faint, as fearing to do so,

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Stay and be secret, and myself will go.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD ROSS
line: To horse, to horse! urge doubts to them that fear.

scene: SCENE I.  Ely House.
speaker: LORD WILLOUGHBY
line: Hold out my horse, and I will first be there.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Madam, your majesty is too much sad:

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: You promised, when you parted with the king,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: To lay aside life-harming heaviness

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: And entertain a cheerful disposition.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: To please the king I did; to please myself

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: I cannot do it; yet I know no cause

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Why I should welcome such a guest as grief,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Save bidding farewell to so sweet a guest

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: As my sweet Richard: yet again, methinks,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Some unborn sorrow, ripe in fortune's womb,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Is coming towards me, and my inward soul

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: With nothing trembles: at some thing it grieves,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: More than with parting from my lord the king.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Each substance of a grief hath twenty shadows,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Which shows like grief itself, but is not so;

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: For sorrow's eye, glazed with blinding tears,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Divides one thing entire to many objects;

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Like perspectives, which rightly gazed upon

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Show nothing but confusion, eyed awry

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Distinguish form: so your sweet majesty,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Looking awry upon your lord's departure,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Find shapes of grief, more than himself, to wail;

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Which, look'd on as it is, is nought but shadows

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Of what it is not. Then, thrice-gracious queen,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: More than your lord's departure weep not: more's not seen;

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Or if it be, 'tis with false sorrow's eye,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Which for things true weeps things imaginary.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: It may be so; but yet my inward soul

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Persuades me it is otherwise: howe'er it be,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: I cannot but be sad; so heavy sad

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: As, though on thinking on no thought I think,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Makes me with heavy nothing faint and shrink.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: 'Tis nothing but conceit, my gracious lady.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: 'Tis nothing less: conceit is still derived

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: From some forefather grief; mine is not so,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: For nothing had begot my something grief;

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Or something hath the nothing that I grieve:

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: 'Tis in reversion that I do possess;

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: But what it is, that is not yet known; what

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: I cannot name; 'tis nameless woe, I wot.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: God save your majesty! and well met, gentlemen:

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: I hope the king is not yet shipp'd for Ireland.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Why hopest thou so? 'tis better hope he is;

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: For his designs crave haste, his haste good hope:

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Then wherefore dost thou hope he is not shipp'd?

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: That he, our hope, might have retired his power,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: And driven into despair an enemy's hope,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: Who strongly hath set footing in this land:

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: The banish'd Bolingbroke repeals himself,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: And with uplifted arms is safe arrived

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: At Ravenspurgh.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Now God in heaven forbid!

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: Ah, madam, 'tis too true: and that is worse,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: The Lord Northumberland, his son young Henry Percy,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: The Lords of Ross, Beaumond, and Willoughby,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: With all their powerful friends, are fled to him.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Why have you not proclaim'd Northumberland

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: And all the rest revolted faction traitors?

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: We have: whereupon the Earl of Worcester

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: Hath broke his staff, resign'd his stewardship,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: And all the household servants fled with him

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: To Bolingbroke.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: So, Green, thou art the midwife to my woe,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: And Bolingbroke my sorrow's dismal heir:

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Now hath my soul brought forth her prodigy,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: And I, a gasping new-deliver'd mother,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Have woe to woe, sorrow to sorrow join'd.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Despair not, madam.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Who shall hinder me?

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: I will despair, and be at enmity

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: With cozening hope: he is a flatterer,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: A parasite, a keeper back of death,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Who gently would dissolve the bands of life,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Which false hope lingers in extremity.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: Here comes the Duke of York.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: With signs of war about his aged neck:

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: O, full of careful business are his looks!

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Uncle, for God's sake, speak comfortable words.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Should I do so, I should belie my thoughts:

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Comfort's in heaven; and we are on the earth,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Where nothing lives but crosses, cares and grief.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Your husband, he is gone to save far off,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Whilst others come to make him lose at home:

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Here am I left to underprop his land,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Who, weak with age, cannot support myself:

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Now comes the sick hour that his surfeit made;

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Now shall he try his friends that flatter'd him.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: Servant
line: My lord, your son was gone before I came.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: He was? Why, so! go all which way it will!

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: The nobles they are fled, the commons they are cold,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: And will, I fear, revolt on Hereford's side.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Sirrah, get thee to Plashy, to my sister Gloucester;

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Bid her send me presently a thousand pound:

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Hold, take my ring.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: Servant
line: My lord, I had forgot to tell your lordship,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: Servant
line: To-day, as I came by, I called there;

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: Servant
line: But I shall grieve you to report the rest.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: What is't, knave?

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: Servant
line: An hour before I came, the duchess died.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: God for his mercy! what a tide of woes

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Comes rushing on this woeful land at once!

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: I know not what to do: I would to God,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: So my untruth had not provoked him to it,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: The king had cut off my head with my brother's.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: What, are there no posts dispatch'd for Ireland?

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: How shall we do for money for these wars?

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Come, sister,--cousin, I would say--pray, pardon me.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Go, fellow, get thee home, provide some carts

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: And bring away the armour that is there.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Gentlemen, will you go muster men?

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: If I know how or which way to order these affairs

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Thus thrust disorderly into my hands,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Never believe me. Both are my kinsmen:

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: The one is my sovereign, whom both my oath

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: And duty bids defend; the other again

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Is my kinsman, whom the king hath wrong'd,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Whom conscience and my kindred bids to right.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Well, somewhat we must do. Come, cousin, I'll

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Dispose of you.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Gentlemen, go, muster up your men,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: And meet me presently at Berkeley.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: I should to Plashy too;

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: But time will not permit: all is uneven,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: And every thing is left at six and seven.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: The wind sits fair for news to go to Ireland,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: But none returns. For us to levy power

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Proportionable to the enemy

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Is all unpossible.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: Besides, our nearness to the king in love

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: Is near the hate of those love not the king.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BAGOT
line: And that's the wavering commons: for their love

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BAGOT
line: Lies in their purses, and whoso empties them

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BAGOT
line: By so much fills their hearts with deadly hate.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Wherein the king stands generally condemn'd.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BAGOT
line: If judgement lie in them, then so do we,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BAGOT
line: Because we ever have been near the king.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: Well, I will for refuge straight to Bristol castle:

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: The Earl of Wiltshire is already there.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Thither will I with you; for little office

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: The hateful commons will perform for us,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Except like curs to tear us all to pieces.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Will you go along with us?

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BAGOT
line: No; I will to Ireland to his majesty.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BAGOT
line: Farewell: if heart's presages be not vain,

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BAGOT
line: We three here art that ne'er shall meet again.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: That's as York thrives to beat back Bolingbroke.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: Alas, poor duke! the task he undertakes

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: Is numbering sands and drinking oceans dry:

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: Where one on his side fights, thousands will fly.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: GREEN
line: Farewell at once, for once, for all, and ever.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Well, we may meet again.

scene: SCENE II.  The palace.
speaker: BAGOT
line: I fear me, never.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: How far is it, my lord, to Berkeley now?

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Believe me, noble lord,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: I am a stranger here in Gloucestershire:

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: These high wild hills and rough uneven ways

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Draws out our miles, and makes them wearisome,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: And yet your fair discourse hath been as sugar,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Making the hard way sweet and delectable.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: But I bethink me what a weary way

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: From Ravenspurgh to Cotswold will be found

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: In Ross and Willoughby, wanting your company,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Which, I protest, hath very much beguiled

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: The tediousness and process of my travel:

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: But theirs is sweetened with the hope to have

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: The present benefit which I possess;

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: And hope to joy is little less in joy

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Than hope enjoy'd: by this the weary lords

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Shall make their way seem short, as mine hath done

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: By sight of what I have, your noble company.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Of much less value is my company

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Than your good words. But who comes here?

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: It is my son, young Harry Percy,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Sent from my brother Worcester, whencesoever.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Harry, how fares your uncle?

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: I had thought, my lord, to have learn'd his health of you.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Why, is he not with the queen?

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: No, my good Lord; he hath forsook the court,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: Broken his staff of office and dispersed

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: The household of the king.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: What was his reason?

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: He was not so resolved when last we spake together.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: Because your lordship was proclaimed traitor.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: But he, my lord, is gone to Ravenspurgh,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: To offer service to the Duke of Hereford,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: And sent me over by Berkeley, to discover

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: What power the Duke of York had levied there;

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: Then with directions to repair to Ravenspurgh.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Have you forgot the Duke of Hereford, boy?

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: No, my good lord, for that is not forgot

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: Which ne'er I did remember: to my knowledge,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: I never in my life did look on him.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Then learn to know him now; this is the duke.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: My gracious lord, I tender you my service,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: Such as it is, being tender, raw and young:

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: Which elder days shall ripen and confirm

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: To more approved service and desert.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: I thank thee, gentle Percy; and be sure

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: I count myself in nothing else so happy

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: As in a soul remembering my good friends;

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And, as my fortune ripens with thy love,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: It shall be still thy true love's recompense:

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: My heart this covenant makes, my hand thus seals it.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: How far is it to Berkeley? and what stir

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Keeps good old York there with his men of war?

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: There stands the castle, by yon tuft of trees,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: Mann'd with three hundred men, as I have heard;

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: And in it are the Lords of York, Berkeley, and Seymour;

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: None else of name and noble estimate.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Here come the Lords of Ross and Willoughby,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Bloody with spurring, fiery-red with haste.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Welcome, my lords. I wot your love pursues

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: A banish'd traitor: all my treasury

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Is yet but unfelt thanks, which more enrich'd

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Shall be your love and labour's recompense.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: LORD ROSS
line: Your presence makes us rich, most noble lord.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: LORD WILLOUGHBY
line: And far surmounts our labour to attain it.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Evermore thanks, the exchequer of the poor;

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Which, till my infant fortune comes to years,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Stands for my bounty. But who comes here?

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: It is my Lord of Berkeley, as I guess.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: LORD BERKELEY
line: My Lord of Hereford, my message is to you.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: My lord, my answer is--to Lancaster;

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And I am come to seek that name in England;

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And I must find that title in your tongue,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Before I make reply to aught you say.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: LORD BERKELEY
line: Mistake me not, my lord; 'tis not my meaning

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: LORD BERKELEY
line: To raze one title of your honour out:

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: LORD BERKELEY
line: To you, my lord, I come, what lord you will,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: LORD BERKELEY
line: From the most gracious regent of this land,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: LORD BERKELEY
line: The Duke of York, to know what pricks you on

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: LORD BERKELEY
line: To take advantage of the absent time

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: LORD BERKELEY
line: And fright our native peace with self-born arms.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: I shall not need transport my words by you;

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Here comes his grace in person. My noble uncle!

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Show me thy humble heart, and not thy knee,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Whose duty is deceiveable and false.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: My gracious uncle--

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Tut, tut!

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Grace me no grace, nor uncle me no uncle:

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: I am no traitor's uncle; and that word 'grace.'

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: In an ungracious mouth is but profane.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Why have those banish'd and forbidden legs

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Dared once to touch a dust of England's ground?

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: But then more 'why?' why have they dared to march

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: So many miles upon her peaceful bosom,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Frighting her pale-faced villages with war

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: And ostentation of despised arms?

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Comest thou because the anointed king is hence?

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Why, foolish boy, the king is left behind,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: And in my loyal bosom lies his power.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Were I but now the lord of such hot youth

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: As when brave Gaunt, thy father, and myself

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Rescued the Black Prince, that young Mars of men,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: From forth the ranks of many thousand French,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: O, then how quickly should this arm of mine.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Now prisoner to the palsy, chastise thee

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: And minister correction to thy fault!

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: My gracious uncle, let me know my fault:

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: On what condition stands it and wherein?

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Even in condition of the worst degree,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: In gross rebellion and detested treason:

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Thou art a banish'd man, and here art come

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Before the expiration of thy time,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: In braving arms against thy sovereign.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: As I was banish'd, I was banish'd Hereford;

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: But as I come, I come for Lancaster.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And, noble uncle, I beseech your grace

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Look on my wrongs with an indifferent eye:

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: You are my father, for methinks in you

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: I see old Gaunt alive; O, then, my father,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Will you permit that I shall stand condemn'd

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: A wandering vagabond; my rights and royalties

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Pluck'd from my arms perforce and given away

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: To upstart unthrifts? Wherefore was I born?

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: If that my cousin king be King of England,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: It must be granted I am Duke of Lancaster.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: You have a son, Aumerle, my noble cousin;

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Had you first died, and he been thus trod down,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: He should have found his uncle Gaunt a father,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: To rouse his wrongs and chase them to the bay.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: I am denied to sue my livery here,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And yet my letters-patents give me leave:

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: My father's goods are all distrain'd and sold,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And these and all are all amiss employ'd.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: What would you have me do? I am a subject,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And I challenge law: attorneys are denied me;

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And therefore, personally I lay my claim

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: To my inheritance of free descent.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: The noble duke hath been too much abused.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: LORD ROSS
line: It stands your grace upon to do him right.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: LORD WILLOUGHBY
line: Base men by his endowments are made great.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: My lords of England, let me tell you this:

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: I have had feeling of my cousin's wrongs

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: And laboured all I could to do him right;

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: But in this kind to come, in braving arms,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Be his own carver and cut out his way,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: To find out right with wrong, it may not be;

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: And you that do abet him in this kind

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Cherish rebellion and are rebels all.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: The noble duke hath sworn his coming is

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: But for his own; and for the right of that

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: We all have strongly sworn to give him aid;

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: And let him ne'er see joy that breaks that oath!

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Well, well, I see the issue of these arms:

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: I cannot mend it, I must needs confess,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Because my power is weak and all ill left:

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: But if I could, by Him that gave me life,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: I would attach you all and make you stoop

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Unto the sovereign mercy of the king;

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: But since I cannot, be it known to you

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: I do remain as neuter. So, fare you well;

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Unless you please to enter in the castle

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: And there repose you for this night.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: An offer, uncle, that we will accept:

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: But we must win your grace to go with us

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: To Bristol castle, which they say is held

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: By Bushy, Bagot and their complices,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: The caterpillars of the commonwealth,

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Which I have sworn to weed and pluck away.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: It may be I will go with you: but yet I'll pause;

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: For I am loath to break our country's laws.

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Nor friends nor foes, to me welcome you are:

scene: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Things past redress are now with me past care.

scene: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.
speaker: Captain
line: My lord of Salisbury, we have stay'd ten days,

scene: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.
speaker: Captain
line: And hardly kept our countrymen together,

scene: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.
speaker: Captain
line: And yet we hear no tidings from the king;

scene: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.
speaker: Captain
line: Therefore we will disperse ourselves: farewell.

scene: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.
speaker: EARL OF SALISBURY
line: Stay yet another day, thou trusty Welshman:

scene: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.
speaker: EARL OF SALISBURY
line: The king reposeth all his confidence in thee.

scene: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.
speaker: Captain
line: 'Tis thought the king is dead; we will not stay.

scene: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.
speaker: Captain
line: The bay-trees in our country are all wither'd

scene: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.
speaker: Captain
line: And meteors fright the fixed stars of heaven;

scene: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.
speaker: Captain
line: The pale-faced moon looks bloody on the earth

scene: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.
speaker: Captain
line: And lean-look'd prophets whisper fearful change;

scene: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.
speaker: Captain
line: Rich men look sad and ruffians dance and leap,

scene: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.
speaker: Captain
line: The one in fear to lose what they enjoy,

scene: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.
speaker: Captain
line: The other to enjoy by rage and war:

scene: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.
speaker: Captain
line: These signs forerun the death or fall of kings.

scene: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.
speaker: Captain
line: Farewell: our countrymen are gone and fled,

scene: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.
speaker: Captain
line: As well assured Richard their king is dead.

scene: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.
speaker: EARL OF SALISBURY
line: Ah, Richard, with the eyes of heavy mind

scene: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.
speaker: EARL OF SALISBURY
line: I see thy glory like a shooting star

scene: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.
speaker: EARL OF SALISBURY
line: Fall to the base earth from the firmament.

scene: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.
speaker: EARL OF SALISBURY
line: Thy sun sets weeping in the lowly west,

scene: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.
speaker: EARL OF SALISBURY
line: Witnessing storms to come, woe and unrest:

scene: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.
speaker: EARL OF SALISBURY
line: Thy friends are fled to wait upon thy foes,

scene: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.
speaker: EARL OF SALISBURY
line: And crossly to thy good all fortune goes.

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Bring forth these men.

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Bushy and Green, I will not vex your souls--

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Since presently your souls must part your bodies--

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: With too much urging your pernicious lives,

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: For 'twere no charity; yet, to wash your blood

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: From off my hands, here in the view of men

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: I will unfold some causes of your deaths.

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: You have misled a prince, a royal king,

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: A happy gentleman in blood and lineaments,

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: By you unhappied and disfigured clean:

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: You have in manner with your sinful hours

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Made a divorce betwixt his queen and him,

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Broke the possession of a royal bed

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And stain'd the beauty of a fair queen's cheeks

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: With tears drawn from her eyes by your foul wrongs.

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Myself, a prince by fortune of my birth,

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Near to the king in blood, and near in love

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Till you did make him misinterpret me,

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Have stoop'd my neck under your injuries,

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And sigh'd my English breath in foreign clouds,

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Eating the bitter bread of banishment;

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Whilst you have fed upon my signories,

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Dispark'd my parks and fell'd my forest woods,

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: From my own windows torn my household coat,

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Razed out my imprese, leaving me no sign,

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Save men's opinions and my living blood,

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: To show the world I am a gentleman.

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: This and much more, much more than twice all this,

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Condemns you to the death. See them deliver'd over

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: To execution and the hand of death.

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: BUSHY
line: More welcome is the stroke of death to me

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: BUSHY
line: Than Bolingbroke to England. Lords, farewell.

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: GREEN
line: My comfort is that heaven will take our souls

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: GREEN
line: And plague injustice with the pains of hell.

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: My Lord Northumberland, see them dispatch'd.

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Uncle, you say the queen is at your house;

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: For God's sake, fairly let her be entreated:

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Tell her I send to her my kind commends;

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Take special care my greetings be deliver'd.

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: A gentleman of mine I have dispatch'd

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: With letters of your love to her at large.

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Thank, gentle uncle. Come, lords, away.

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: To fight with Glendower and his complices:

scene: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Awhile to work, and after holiday.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Barkloughly castle call they this at hand?

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Yea, my lord. How brooks your grace the air,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: After your late tossing on the breaking seas?

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Needs must I like it well: I weep for joy

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To stand upon my kingdom once again.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Dear earth, I do salute thee with my hand,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Though rebels wound thee with their horses' hoofs:

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: As a long-parted mother with her child

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Plays fondly with her tears and smiles in meeting,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: So, weeping, smiling, greet I thee, my earth,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And do thee favours with my royal hands.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Feed not thy sovereign's foe, my gentle earth,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Nor with thy sweets comfort his ravenous sense;

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: But let thy spiders, that suck up thy venom,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And heavy-gaited toads lie in their way,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Doing annoyance to the treacherous feet

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Which with usurping steps do trample thee:

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Yield stinging nettles to mine enemies;

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And when they from thy bosom pluck a flower,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Guard it, I pray thee, with a lurking adder

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Whose double tongue may with a mortal touch

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Throw death upon thy sovereign's enemies.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Mock not my senseless conjuration, lords:

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: This earth shall have a feeling and these stones

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Prove armed soldiers, ere her native king

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Shall falter under foul rebellion's arms.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Fear not, my lord: that Power that made you king

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Hath power to keep you king in spite of all.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: The means that heaven yields must be embraced,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: And not neglected; else, if heaven would,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: And we will not, heaven's offer we refuse,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: The proffer'd means of succor and redress.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: He means, my lord, that we are too remiss;

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Whilst Bolingbroke, through our security,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Grows strong and great in substance and in power.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Discomfortable cousin! know'st thou not

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That when the searching eye of heaven is hid,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Behind the globe, that lights the lower world,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Then thieves and robbers range abroad unseen

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: In murders and in outrage, boldly here;

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: But when from under this terrestrial ball

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: He fires the proud tops of the eastern pines

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And darts his light through every guilty hole,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Then murders, treasons and detested sins,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The cloak of night being pluck'd from off their backs,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Stand bare and naked, trembling at themselves?

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: So when this thief, this traitor, Bolingbroke,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Who all this while hath revell'd in the night

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Whilst we were wandering with the antipodes,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Shall see us rising in our throne, the east,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: His treasons will sit blushing in his face,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Not able to endure the sight of day,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: But self-affrighted tremble at his sin.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Not all the water in the rough rude sea

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Can wash the balm off from an anointed king;

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The breath of worldly men cannot depose

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The deputy elected by the Lord:

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: For every man that Bolingbroke hath press'd

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To lift shrewd steel against our golden crown,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: God for his Richard hath in heavenly pay

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: A glorious angel: then, if angels fight,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Weak men must fall, for heaven still guards the right.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Welcome, my lord how far off lies your power?

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: EARL OF SALISBURY
line: Nor near nor farther off, my gracious lord,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: EARL OF SALISBURY
line: Than this weak arm: discomfort guides my tongue

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: EARL OF SALISBURY
line: And bids me speak of nothing but despair.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: EARL OF SALISBURY
line: One day too late, I fear me, noble lord,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: EARL OF SALISBURY
line: Hath clouded all thy happy days on earth:

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: EARL OF SALISBURY
line: O, call back yesterday, bid time return,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: EARL OF SALISBURY
line: And thou shalt have twelve thousand fighting men!

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: EARL OF SALISBURY
line: To-day, to-day, unhappy day, too late,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: EARL OF SALISBURY
line: O'erthrows thy joys, friends, fortune and thy state:

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: EARL OF SALISBURY
line: For all the Welshmen, hearing thou wert dead.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: EARL OF SALISBURY
line: Are gone to Bolingbroke, dispersed and fled.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Comfort, my liege; why looks your grace so pale?

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: But now the blood of twenty thousand men

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Did triumph in my face, and they are fled;

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And, till so much blood thither come again,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Have I not reason to look pale and dead?

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: All souls that will be safe fly from my side,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: For time hath set a blot upon my pride.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Comfort, my liege; remember who you are.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: I had forgot myself; am I not king?

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Awake, thou coward majesty! thou sleepest.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Is not the king's name twenty thousand names?

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Arm, arm, my name! a puny subject strikes

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: At thy great glory. Look not to the ground,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Ye favourites of a king: are we not high?

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: High be our thoughts: I know my uncle York

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Hath power enough to serve our turn. But who comes here?

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: More health and happiness betide my liege

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: Than can my care-tuned tongue deliver him!

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Mine ear is open and my heart prepared;

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The worst is worldly loss thou canst unfold.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Say, is my kingdom lost? why, 'twas my care

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And what loss is it to be rid of care?

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Strives Bolingbroke to be as great as we?

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Greater he shall not be; if he serve God,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: We'll serve Him too and be his fellow so:

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Revolt our subjects? that we cannot mend;

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: They break their faith to God as well as us:

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Cry woe, destruction, ruin and decay:

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The worst is death, and death will have his day.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: Glad am I that your highness is so arm'd

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: To bear the tidings of calamity.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: Like an unseasonable stormy day,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: Which makes the silver rivers drown their shores,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: As if the world were all dissolved to tears,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: So high above his limits swells the rage

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: Of Bolingbroke, covering your fearful land

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: With hard bright steel and hearts harder than steel.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: White-beards have arm'd their thin and hairless scalps

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: Against thy majesty; boys, with women's voices,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: Strive to speak big and clap their female joints

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: In stiff unwieldy arms against thy crown:

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: The very beadsmen learn to bend their bows

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: Of double-fatal yew against thy state;

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: Yea, distaff-women manage rusty bills

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: Against thy seat: both young and old rebel,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: And all goes worse than I have power to tell.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Too well, too well thou tell'st a tale so ill.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Where is the Earl of Wiltshire? where is Bagot?

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: What is become of Bushy? where is Green?

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That they have let the dangerous enemy

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Measure our confines with such peaceful steps?

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: If we prevail, their heads shall pay for it:

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: I warrant they have made peace with Bolingbroke.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: Peace have they made with him indeed, my lord.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: O villains, vipers, damn'd without redemption!

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Dogs, easily won to fawn on any man!

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Snakes, in my heart-blood warm'd, that sting my heart!

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Three Judases, each one thrice worse than Judas!

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Would they make peace? terrible hell make war

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Upon their spotted souls for this offence!

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: Sweet love, I see, changing his property,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: Turns to the sourest and most deadly hate:

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: Again uncurse their souls; their peace is made

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: With heads, and not with hands; those whom you curse

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: Have felt the worst of death's destroying wound

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: And lie full low, graved in the hollow ground.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Is Bushy, Green, and the Earl of Wiltshire dead?

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: Ay, all of them at Bristol lost their heads.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Where is the duke my father with his power?

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: No matter where; of comfort no man speak:

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Let's talk of graves, of worms, and epitaphs;

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Make dust our paper and with rainy eyes

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Write sorrow on the bosom of the earth,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Let's choose executors and talk of wills:

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And yet not so, for what can we bequeath

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Save our deposed bodies to the ground?

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Our lands, our lives and all are Bolingbroke's,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And nothing can we call our own but death

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And that small model of the barren earth

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Which serves as paste and cover to our bones.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: For God's sake, let us sit upon the ground

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And tell sad stories of the death of kings;

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: How some have been deposed; some slain in war,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Some haunted by the ghosts they have deposed;

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Some poison'd by their wives: some sleeping kill'd;

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: All murder'd: for within the hollow crown

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That rounds the mortal temples of a king

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Keeps Death his court and there the antic sits,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Scoffing his state and grinning at his pomp,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Allowing him a breath, a little scene,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To monarchize, be fear'd and kill with looks,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Infusing him with self and vain conceit,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: As if this flesh which walls about our life,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Were brass impregnable, and humour'd thus

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Comes at the last and with a little pin

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Bores through his castle wall, and farewell king!

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Cover your heads and mock not flesh and blood

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: With solemn reverence: throw away respect,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Tradition, form and ceremonious duty,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: For you have but mistook me all this while:

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: I live with bread like you, feel want,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Taste grief, need friends: subjected thus,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: How can you say to me, I am a king?

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: My lord, wise men ne'er sit and wail their woes,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: But presently prevent the ways to wail.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: To fear the foe, since fear oppresseth strength,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Gives in your weakness strength unto your foe,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: And so your follies fight against yourself.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Fear and be slain; no worse can come to fight:

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: And fight and die is death destroying death;

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Where fearing dying pays death servile breath.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: My father hath a power; inquire of him

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: And learn to make a body of a limb.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Thou chidest me well: proud Bolingbroke, I come

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To change blows with thee for our day of doom.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: This ague fit of fear is over-blown;

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: An easy task it is to win our own.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Say, Scroop, where lies our uncle with his power?

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Speak sweetly, man, although thy looks be sour.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: Men judge by the complexion of the sky

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: The state and inclination of the day:

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: So may you by my dull and heavy eye,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: My tongue hath but a heavier tale to say.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: I play the torturer, by small and small

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: To lengthen out the worst that must be spoken:

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: Your uncle York is join'd with Bolingbroke,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: And all your northern castles yielded up,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: And all your southern gentlemen in arms

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: SIR STEPHEN SCROOP
line: Upon his party.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Thou hast said enough.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Beshrew thee, cousin, which didst lead me forth

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Of that sweet way I was in to despair!

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: What say you now? what comfort have we now?

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: By heaven, I'll hate him everlastingly

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That bids me be of comfort any more.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Go to Flint castle: there I'll pine away;

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: A king, woe's slave, shall kingly woe obey.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That power I have, discharge; and let them go

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To ear the land that hath some hope to grow,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: For I have none: let no man speak again

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To alter this, for counsel is but vain.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: My liege, one word.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: He does me double wrong

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That wounds me with the flatteries of his tongue.

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Discharge my followers: let them hence away,

scene: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: From Richard's night to Bolingbroke's fair day.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: So that by this intelligence we learn

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: The Welshmen are dispersed, and Salisbury

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Is gone to meet the king, who lately landed

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: With some few private friends upon this coast.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: The news is very fair and good, my lord:

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Richard not far from hence hath hid his head.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: It would beseem the Lord Northumberland

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: To say 'King Richard:' alack the heavy day

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: When such a sacred king should hide his head.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Your grace mistakes; only to be brief

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Left I his title out.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: The time hath been,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Would you have been so brief with him, he would

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Have been so brief with you, to shorten you,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: For taking so the head, your whole head's length.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Mistake not, uncle, further than you should.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Take not, good cousin, further than you should.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Lest you mistake the heavens are o'er our heads.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: I know it, uncle, and oppose not myself

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Against their will. But who comes here?

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Welcome, Harry: what, will not this castle yield?

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: The castle royally is mann'd, my lord,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: Against thy entrance.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Royally!

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Why, it contains no king?

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: Yes, my good lord,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: It doth contain a king; King Richard lies

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: Within the limits of yon lime and stone:

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: And with him are the Lord Aumerle, Lord Salisbury,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: Sir Stephen Scroop, besides a clergyman

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: Of holy reverence; who, I cannot learn.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: O, belike it is the Bishop of Carlisle.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Noble lords,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Go to the rude ribs of that ancient castle;

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
