line: Through brazen trumpet send the breath of parley

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Into his ruin'd ears, and thus deliver:

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Henry Bolingbroke

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: On both his knees doth kiss King Richard's hand

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And sends allegiance and true faith of heart

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: To his most royal person, hither come

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Even at his feet to lay my arms and power,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Provided that my banishment repeal'd

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And lands restored again be freely granted:

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: If not, I'll use the advantage of my power

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And lay the summer's dust with showers of blood

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Rain'd from the wounds of slaughter'd Englishmen:

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: The which, how far off from the mind of Bolingbroke

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: It is, such crimson tempest should bedrench

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: The fresh green lap of fair King Richard's land,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: My stooping duty tenderly shall show.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Go, signify as much, while here we march

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Upon the grassy carpet of this plain.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Let's march without the noise of threatening drum,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: That from this castle's tatter'd battlements

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Our fair appointments may be well perused.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Methinks King Richard and myself should meet

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: With no less terror than the elements

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Of fire and water, when their thundering shock

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: At meeting tears the cloudy cheeks of heaven.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Be he the fire, I'll be the yielding water:

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: The rage be his, whilst on the earth I rain

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: My waters; on the earth, and not on him.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: March on, and mark King Richard how he looks.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: See, see, King Richard doth himself appear,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: As doth the blushing discontented sun

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: From out the fiery portal of the east,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: When he perceives the envious clouds are bent

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: To dim his glory and to stain the track

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Of his bright passage to the occident.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Yet looks he like a king: behold, his eye,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: As bright as is the eagle's, lightens forth

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Controlling majesty: alack, alack, for woe,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: That any harm should stain so fair a show!

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: We are amazed; and thus long have we stood

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To watch the fearful bending of thy knee,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Because we thought ourself thy lawful king:

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And if we be, how dare thy joints forget

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To pay their awful duty to our presence?

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: If we be not, show us the hand of God

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That hath dismissed us from our stewardship;

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: For well we know, no hand of blood and bone

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Can gripe the sacred handle of our sceptre,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Unless he do profane, steal, or usurp.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And though you think that all, as you have done,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Have torn their souls by turning them from us,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And we are barren and bereft of friends;

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Yet know, my master, God omnipotent,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Is mustering in his clouds on our behalf

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Armies of pestilence; and they shall strike

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Your children yet unborn and unbegot,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That lift your vassal hands against my head

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And threat the glory of my precious crown.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Tell Bolingbroke--for yond methinks he stands--

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That every stride he makes upon my land

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Is dangerous treason: he is come to open

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The purple testament of bleeding war;

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: But ere the crown he looks for live in peace,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Ten thousand bloody crowns of mothers' sons

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Shall ill become the flower of England's face,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Change the complexion of her maid-pale peace

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To scarlet indignation and bedew

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Her pastures' grass with faithful English blood.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: The king of heaven forbid our lord the king

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Should so with civil and uncivil arms

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Be rush'd upon! Thy thrice noble cousin

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Harry Bolingbroke doth humbly kiss thy hand;

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: And by the honourable tomb he swears,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: That stands upon your royal grandsire's bones,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: And by the royalties of both your bloods,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Currents that spring from one most gracious head,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: And by the buried hand of warlike Gaunt,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: And by the worth and honour of himself,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Comprising all that may be sworn or said,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: His coming hither hath no further scope

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Than for his lineal royalties and to beg

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Enfranchisement immediate on his knees:

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Which on thy royal party granted once,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: His glittering arms he will commend to rust,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: His barbed steeds to stables, and his heart

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: To faithful service of your majesty.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: This swears he, as he is a prince, is just;

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: And, as I am a gentleman, I credit him.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Northumberland, say thus the king returns:

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: His noble cousin is right welcome hither;

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And all the number of his fair demands

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Shall be accomplish'd without contradiction:

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: With all the gracious utterance thou hast

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Speak to his gentle hearing kind commends.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: We do debase ourselves, cousin, do we not,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To look so poorly and to speak so fair?

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Shall we call back Northumberland, and send

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Defiance to the traitor, and so die?

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: No, good my lord; let's fight with gentle words

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Till time lend friends and friends their helpful swords.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: O God, O God! that e'er this tongue of mine,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That laid the sentence of dread banishment

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: On yon proud man, should take it off again

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: With words of sooth! O that I were as great

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: As is my grief, or lesser than my name!

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Or that I could forget what I have been,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Or not remember what I must be now!

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Swell'st thou, proud heart? I'll give thee scope to beat,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Since foes have scope to beat both thee and me.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Northumberland comes back from Bolingbroke.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: What must the king do now? must he submit?

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The king shall do it: must he be deposed?

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The king shall be contented: must he lose

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The name of king? o' God's name, let it go:

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: I'll give my jewels for a set of beads,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: My gorgeous palace for a hermitage,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: My gay apparel for an almsman's gown,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: My figured goblets for a dish of wood,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: My sceptre for a palmer's walking staff,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: My subjects for a pair of carved saints

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And my large kingdom for a little grave,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: A little little grave, an obscure grave;

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Or I'll be buried in the king's highway,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Some way of common trade, where subjects' feet

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: May hourly trample on their sovereign's head;

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: For on my heart they tread now whilst I live;

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And buried once, why not upon my head?

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Aumerle, thou weep'st, my tender-hearted cousin!

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: We'll make foul weather with despised tears;

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Our sighs and they shall lodge the summer corn,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And make a dearth in this revolting land.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Or shall we play the wantons with our woes,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And make some pretty match with shedding tears?

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: As thus, to drop them still upon one place,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Till they have fretted us a pair of graves

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Within the earth; and, therein laid,--there lies

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Two kinsmen digg'd their graves with weeping eyes.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Would not this ill do well? Well, well, I see

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: I talk but idly, and you laugh at me.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Most mighty prince, my Lord Northumberland,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: What says King Bolingbroke? will his majesty

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Give Richard leave to live till Richard die?

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: You make a leg, and Bolingbroke says ay.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: My lord, in the base court he doth attend

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: To speak with you; may it please you to come down.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Down, down I come; like glistering Phaethon,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Wanting the manage of unruly jades.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: In the base court? Base court, where kings grow base,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To come at traitors' calls and do them grace.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: In the base court? Come down? Down, court!

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: down, king!

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: For night-owls shriek where mounting larks

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: should sing.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: What says his majesty?

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Sorrow and grief of heart

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Makes him speak fondly, like a frantic man

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Yet he is come.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Stand all apart,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And show fair duty to his majesty.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: My gracious lord,--

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Fair cousin, you debase your princely knee

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To make the base earth proud with kissing it:

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Me rather had my heart might feel your love

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Than my unpleased eye see your courtesy.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Up, cousin, up; your heart is up, I know,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Thus high at least, although your knee be low.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: My gracious lord, I come but for mine own.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Your own is yours, and I am yours, and all.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: So far be mine, my most redoubted lord,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: As my true service shall deserve your love.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Well you deserve: they well deserve to have,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That know the strong'st and surest way to get.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Uncle, give me your hands: nay, dry your eyes;

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Tears show their love, but want their remedies.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Cousin, I am too young to be your father,

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Though you are old enough to be my heir.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: What you will have, I'll give, and willing too;

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: For do we must what force will have us do.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Set on towards London, cousin, is it so?

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Yea, my good lord.

scene: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Then I must not say no.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: What sport shall we devise here in this garden,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: To drive away the heavy thought of care?

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Lady
line: Madam, we'll play at bowls.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: 'Twill make me think the world is full of rubs,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: And that my fortune rubs against the bias.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Lady
line: Madam, we'll dance.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: My legs can keep no measure in delight,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: When my poor heart no measure keeps in grief:

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Therefore, no dancing, girl; some other sport.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Lady
line: Madam, we'll tell tales.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Of sorrow or of joy?

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Lady
line: Of either, madam.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Of neither, girl:

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: For of joy, being altogether wanting,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: It doth remember me the more of sorrow;

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Or if of grief, being altogether had,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: It adds more sorrow to my want of joy:

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: For what I have I need not to repeat;

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: And what I want it boots not to complain.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Lady
line: Madam, I'll sing.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: 'Tis well that thou hast cause

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: But thou shouldst please me better, wouldst thou weep.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Lady
line: I could weep, madam, would it do you good.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: And I could sing, would weeping do me good,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: And never borrow any tear of thee.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: But stay, here come the gardeners:

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Let's step into the shadow of these trees.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: My wretchedness unto a row of pins,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: They'll talk of state; for every one doth so

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Against a change; woe is forerun with woe.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: Go, bind thou up yon dangling apricocks,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: Which, like unruly children, make their sire

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: Stoop with oppression of their prodigal weight:

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: Give some supportance to the bending twigs.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: Go thou, and like an executioner,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: Cut off the heads of too fast growing sprays,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: That look too lofty in our commonwealth:

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: All must be even in our government.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: You thus employ'd, I will go root away

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: The noisome weeds, which without profit suck

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: The soil's fertility from wholesome flowers.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Servant
line: Why should we in the compass of a pale

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Servant
line: Keep law and form and due proportion,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Servant
line: Showing, as in a model, our firm estate,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Servant
line: When our sea-walled garden, the whole land,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Servant
line: Is full of weeds, her fairest flowers choked up,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Servant
line: Her fruit-trees all upturned, her hedges ruin'd,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Servant
line: Her knots disorder'd and her wholesome herbs

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Servant
line: Swarming with caterpillars?

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: Hold thy peace:

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: He that hath suffer'd this disorder'd spring

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: Hath now himself met with the fall of leaf:

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: The weeds which his broad-spreading leaves did shelter,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: That seem'd in eating him to hold him up,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: Are pluck'd up root and all by Bolingbroke,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: I mean the Earl of Wiltshire, Bushy, Green.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Servant
line: What, are they dead?

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: They are; and Bolingbroke

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: Hath seized the wasteful king. O, what pity is it

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: That he had not so trimm'd and dress'd his land

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: As we this garden! We at time of year

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: Do wound the bark, the skin of our fruit-trees,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: Lest, being over-proud in sap and blood,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: With too much riches it confound itself:

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: Had he done so to great and growing men,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: They might have lived to bear and he to taste

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: Their fruits of duty: superfluous branches

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: We lop away, that bearing boughs may live:

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: Had he done so, himself had borne the crown,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: Which waste of idle hours hath quite thrown down.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Servant
line: What, think you then the king shall be deposed?

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: Depress'd he is already, and deposed

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: 'Tis doubt he will be: letters came last night

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: To a dear friend of the good Duke of York's,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: That tell black tidings.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: O, I am press'd to death through want of speaking!

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Thou, old Adam's likeness, set to dress this garden,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: How dares thy harsh rude tongue sound this unpleasing news?

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: What Eve, what serpent, hath suggested thee

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: To make a second fall of cursed man?

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Why dost thou say King Richard is deposed?

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Darest thou, thou little better thing than earth,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Divine his downfall? Say, where, when, and how,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Camest thou by this ill tidings? speak, thou wretch.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: Pardon me, madam: little joy have I

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: To breathe this news; yet what I say is true.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: King Richard, he is in the mighty hold

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: Of Bolingbroke: their fortunes both are weigh'd:

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: In your lord's scale is nothing but himself,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: And some few vanities that make him light;

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: But in the balance of great Bolingbroke,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: Besides himself, are all the English peers,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: And with that odds he weighs King Richard down.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: Post you to London, and you will find it so;

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: Gardener
line: I speak no more than every one doth know.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Nimble mischance, that art so light of foot,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Doth not thy embassage belong to me,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: And am I last that knows it? O, thou think'st

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: To serve me last, that I may longest keep

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Thy sorrow in my breast. Come, ladies, go,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: To meet at London London's king in woe.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: What, was I born to this, that my sad look

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Should grace the triumph of great Bolingbroke?

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Gardener, for telling me these news of woe,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Pray God the plants thou graft'st may never grow.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: GARDENER
line: Poor queen! so that thy state might be no worse,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: GARDENER
line: I would my skill were subject to thy curse.

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: GARDENER
line: Here did she fall a tear; here in this place

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: GARDENER
line: I'll set a bank of rue, sour herb of grace:

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: GARDENER
line: Rue, even for ruth, here shortly shall be seen,

scene: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.
speaker: GARDENER
line: In the remembrance of a weeping queen.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Call forth Bagot.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Now, Bagot, freely speak thy mind;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: What thou dost know of noble Gloucester's death,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Who wrought it with the king, and who perform'd

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: The bloody office of his timeless end.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BAGOT
line: Then set before my face the Lord Aumerle.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Cousin, stand forth, and look upon that man.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BAGOT
line: My Lord Aumerle, I know your daring tongue

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BAGOT
line: Scorns to unsay what once it hath deliver'd.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BAGOT
line: In that dead time when Gloucester's death was plotted,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BAGOT
line: I heard you say, 'Is not my arm of length,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BAGOT
line: That reacheth from the restful English court

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BAGOT
line: As far as Calais, to mine uncle's head?'

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BAGOT
line: Amongst much other talk, that very time,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BAGOT
line: I heard you say that you had rather refuse

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BAGOT
line: The offer of an hundred thousand crowns

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BAGOT
line: Than Bolingbroke's return to England;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BAGOT
line: Adding withal how blest this land would be

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BAGOT
line: In this your cousin's death.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Princes and noble lords,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: What answer shall I make to this base man?

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Shall I so much dishonour my fair stars,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: On equal terms to give him chastisement?

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Either I must, or have mine honour soil'd

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: With the attainder of his slanderous lips.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: There is my gage, the manual seal of death,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: That marks thee out for hell: I say, thou liest,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: And will maintain what thou hast said is false

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: In thy heart-blood, though being all too base

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: To stain the temper of my knightly sword.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Bagot, forbear; thou shalt not take it up.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Excepting one, I would he were the best

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: In all this presence that hath moved me so.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: If that thy valour stand on sympathy,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: There is my gage, Aumerle, in gage to thine:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: By that fair sun which shows me where thou stand'st,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: I heard thee say, and vauntingly thou spakest it

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: That thou wert cause of noble Gloucester's death.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: If thou deny'st it twenty times, thou liest;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: And I will turn thy falsehood to thy heart,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: Where it was forged, with my rapier's point.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Thou darest not, coward, live to see that day.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: Now by my soul, I would it were this hour.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Fitzwater, thou art damn'd to hell for this.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: Aumerle, thou liest; his honour is as true

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: In this appeal as thou art all unjust;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: And that thou art so, there I throw my gage,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: To prove it on thee to the extremest point

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: Of mortal breathing: seize it, if thou darest.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: An if I do not, may my hands rot off

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: And never brandish more revengeful steel

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Over the glittering helmet of my foe!

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: Lord
line: I task the earth to the like, forsworn Aumerle;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: Lord
line: And spur thee on with full as many lies

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: Lord
line: As may be holloa'd in thy treacherous ear

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: Lord
line: From sun to sun: there is my honour's pawn;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: Lord
line: Engage it to the trial, if thou darest.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Who sets me else? by heaven, I'll throw at all:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: I have a thousand spirits in one breast,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: To answer twenty thousand such as you.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF SURREY
line: My Lord Fitzwater, I do remember well

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF SURREY
line: The very time Aumerle and you did talk.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: 'Tis very true: you were in presence then;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: And you can witness with me this is true.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF SURREY
line: As false, by heaven, as heaven itself is true.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: Surrey, thou liest.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF SURREY
line: Dishonourable boy!

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF SURREY
line: That lie shall lie so heavy on my sword,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF SURREY
line: That it shall render vengeance and revenge

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF SURREY
line: Till thou the lie-giver and that lie do lie

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF SURREY
line: In earth as quiet as thy father's skull:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF SURREY
line: In proof whereof, there is my honour's pawn;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF SURREY
line: Engage it to the trial, if thou darest.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: How fondly dost thou spur a forward horse!

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: If I dare eat, or drink, or breathe, or live,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: I dare meet Surrey in a wilderness,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: And spit upon him, whilst I say he lies,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: And lies, and lies: there is my bond of faith,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: To tie thee to my strong correction.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: As I intend to thrive in this new world,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: Aumerle is guilty of my true appeal:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: Besides, I heard the banish'd Norfolk say

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: That thou, Aumerle, didst send two of thy men

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: To execute the noble duke at Calais.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Some honest Christian trust me with a gage

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: That Norfolk lies: here do I throw down this,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: If he may be repeal'd, to try his honour.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: These differences shall all rest under gage

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Till Norfolk be repeal'd: repeal'd he shall be,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And, though mine enemy, restored again

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: To all his lands and signories: when he's return'd,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Against Aumerle we will enforce his trial.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: That honourable day shall ne'er be seen.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Many a time hath banish'd Norfolk fought

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: For Jesu Christ in glorious Christian field,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Streaming the ensign of the Christian cross

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Against black pagans, Turks, and Saracens:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: And toil'd with works of war, retired himself

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: To Italy; and there at Venice gave

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: His body to that pleasant country's earth,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: And his pure soul unto his captain Christ,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Under whose colours he had fought so long.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Why, bishop, is Norfolk dead?

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: As surely as I live, my lord.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Sweet peace conduct his sweet soul to the bosom

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Of good old Abraham! Lords appellants,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Your differences shall all rest under gage

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Till we assign you to your days of trial.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Great Duke of Lancaster, I come to thee

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: From plume-pluck'd Richard; who with willing soul

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Adopts thee heir, and his high sceptre yields

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: To the possession of thy royal hand:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Ascend his throne, descending now from him;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: And long live Henry, fourth of that name!

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: In God's name, I'll ascend the regal throne.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Marry. God forbid!

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Worst in this royal presence may I speak,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Yet best beseeming me to speak the truth.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Would God that any in this noble presence

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Were enough noble to be upright judge

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Of noble Richard! then true noblesse would

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Learn him forbearance from so foul a wrong.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: What subject can give sentence on his king?

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: And who sits here that is not Richard's subject?

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Thieves are not judged but they are by to hear,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Although apparent guilt be seen in them;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: And shall the figure of God's majesty,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: His captain, steward, deputy-elect,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Anointed, crowned, planted many years,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Be judged by subject and inferior breath,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: And he himself not present? O, forfend it, God,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: That in a Christian climate souls refined

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Should show so heinous, black, obscene a deed!

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: I speak to subjects, and a subject speaks,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Stirr'd up by God, thus boldly for his king:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: My Lord of Hereford here, whom you call king,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Is a foul traitor to proud Hereford's king:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: And if you crown him, let me prophesy:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: The blood of English shall manure the ground,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: And future ages groan for this foul act;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Peace shall go sleep with Turks and infidels,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: And in this seat of peace tumultuous wars

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Shall kin with kin and kind with kind confound;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Disorder, horror, fear and mutiny

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Shall here inhabit, and this land be call'd

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: The field of Golgotha and dead men's skulls.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: O, if you raise this house against this house,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: It will the woefullest division prove

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: That ever fell upon this cursed earth.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Prevent it, resist it, let it not be so,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Lest child, child's children, cry against you woe!

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Well have you argued, sir; and, for your pains,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Of capital treason we arrest you here.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: My Lord of Westminster, be it your charge

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: To keep him safely till his day of trial.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: May it please you, lords, to grant the commons' suit.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Fetch hither Richard, that in common view

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: He may surrender; so we shall proceed

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Without suspicion.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: I will be his conduct.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Lords, you that here are under our arrest,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Procure your sureties for your days of answer.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Little are we beholding to your love,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And little look'd for at your helping hands.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Alack, why am I sent for to a king,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Before I have shook off the regal thoughts

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Wherewith I reign'd? I hardly yet have learn'd

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To insinuate, flatter, bow, and bend my limbs:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Give sorrow leave awhile to tutor me

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To this submission. Yet I well remember

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The favours of these men: were they not mine?

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Did they not sometime cry, 'all hail!' to me?

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: So Judas did to Christ: but he, in twelve,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Found truth in all but one: I, in twelve thousand, none.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: God save the king! Will no man say amen?

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Am I both priest and clerk? well then, amen.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: God save the king! although I be not he;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And yet, amen, if heaven do think him me.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To do what service am I sent for hither?

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: To do that office of thine own good will

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Which tired majesty did make thee offer,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: The resignation of thy state and crown

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: To Henry Bolingbroke.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Give me the crown. Here, cousin, seize the crown;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Here cousin:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: On this side my hand, and on that side yours.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Now is this golden crown like a deep well

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That owes two buckets, filling one another,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The emptier ever dancing in the air,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The other down, unseen and full of water:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That bucket down and full of tears am I,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Drinking my griefs, whilst you mount up on high.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: I thought you had been willing to resign.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: My crown I am; but still my griefs are mine:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: You may my glories and my state depose,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: But not my griefs; still am I king of those.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Part of your cares you give me with your crown.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Your cares set up do not pluck my cares down.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: My care is loss of care, by old care done;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Your care is gain of care, by new care won:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The cares I give I have, though given away;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: They tend the crown, yet still with me they stay.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Are you contented to resign the crown?

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Ay, no; no, ay; for I must nothing be;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Therefore no no, for I resign to thee.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Now mark me, how I will undo myself;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: I give this heavy weight from off my head

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And this unwieldy sceptre from my hand,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The pride of kingly sway from out my heart;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: With mine own tears I wash away my balm,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: With mine own hands I give away my crown,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: With mine own tongue deny my sacred state,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: With mine own breath release all duty's rites:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: All pomp and majesty I do forswear;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: My manors, rents, revenues I forego;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: My acts, decrees, and statutes I deny:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: God pardon all oaths that are broke to me!

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: God keep all vows unbroke that swear to thee!

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Make me, that nothing have, with nothing grieved,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And thou with all pleased, that hast all achieved!

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Long mayst thou live in Richard's seat to sit,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And soon lie Richard in an earthly pit!

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: God save King Harry, unking'd Richard says,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And send him many years of sunshine days!

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: What more remains?

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: No more, but that you read

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: These accusations and these grievous crimes

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Committed by your person and your followers

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Against the state and profit of this land;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: That, by confessing them, the souls of men

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: May deem that you are worthily deposed.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Must I do so? and must I ravel out

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: My weaved-up folly? Gentle Northumberland,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: If thy offences were upon record,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Would it not shame thee in so fair a troop

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To read a lecture of them? If thou wouldst,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: There shouldst thou find one heinous article,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Containing the deposing of a king

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And cracking the strong warrant of an oath,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Mark'd with a blot, damn'd in the book of heaven:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Nay, all of you that stand and look upon,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Whilst that my wretchedness doth bait myself,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Though some of you with Pilate wash your hands

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Showing an outward pity; yet you Pilates

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Have here deliver'd me to my sour cross,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And water cannot wash away your sin.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: My lord, dispatch; read o'er these articles.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Mine eyes are full of tears, I cannot see:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And yet salt water blinds them not so much

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: But they can see a sort of traitors here.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Nay, if I turn mine eyes upon myself,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: I find myself a traitor with the rest;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: For I have given here my soul's consent

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To undeck the pompous body of a king;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Made glory base and sovereignty a slave,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Proud majesty a subject, state a peasant.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: My lord,--

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: No lord of thine, thou haught insulting man,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Nor no man's lord; I have no name, no title,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: No, not that name was given me at the font,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: But 'tis usurp'd: alack the heavy day,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That I have worn so many winters out,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And know not now what name to call myself!

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: O that I were a mockery king of snow,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Standing before the sun of Bolingbroke,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To melt myself away in water-drops!

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Good king, great king, and yet not greatly good,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: An if my word be sterling yet in England,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Let it command a mirror hither straight,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That it may show me what a face I have,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Since it is bankrupt of his majesty.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Go some of you and fetch a looking-glass.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Read o'er this paper while the glass doth come.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Fiend, thou torment'st me ere I come to hell!

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Urge it no more, my Lord Northumberland.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: The commons will not then be satisfied.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: They shall be satisfied: I'll read enough,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: When I do see the very book indeed

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Where all my sins are writ, and that's myself.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Give me the glass, and therein will I read.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: No deeper wrinkles yet? hath sorrow struck

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: So many blows upon this face of mine,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And made no deeper wounds? O flattering glass,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Like to my followers in prosperity,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Thou dost beguile me! Was this face the face

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That every day under his household roof

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Did keep ten thousand men? was this the face

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That, like the sun, did make beholders wink?

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Was this the face that faced so many follies,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And was at last out-faced by Bolingbroke?

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: A brittle glory shineth in this face:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: As brittle as the glory is the face;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: For there it is, crack'd in a hundred shivers.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Mark, silent king, the moral of this sport,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: How soon my sorrow hath destroy'd my face.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: The shadow of your sorrow hath destroy'd

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: The shadow or your face.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Say that again.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The shadow of my sorrow! ha! let's see:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: 'Tis very true, my grief lies all within;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And these external manners of laments

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Are merely shadows to the unseen grief

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That swells with silence in the tortured soul;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: There lies the substance: and I thank thee, king,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: For thy great bounty, that not only givest

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Me cause to wail but teachest me the way

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: How to lament the cause. I'll beg one boon,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And then be gone and trouble you no more.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Shall I obtain it?

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Name it, fair cousin.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: 'Fair cousin'? I am greater than a king:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: For when I was a king, my flatterers

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Were then but subjects; being now a subject,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: I have a king here to my flatterer.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Being so great, I have no need to beg.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Yet ask.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And shall I have?

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: You shall.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Then give me leave to go.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Whither?

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Whither you will, so I were from your sights.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Go, some of you convey him to the Tower.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: O, good! convey? conveyers are you all,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That rise thus nimbly by a true king's fall.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: On Wednesday next we solemnly set down

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Our coronation: lords, prepare yourselves.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: Abbot
line: A woeful pageant have we here beheld.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: The woe's to come; the children yet unborn.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: BISHOP OF CARLISLE
line: Shall feel this day as sharp to them as thorn.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: You holy clergymen, is there no plot

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: To rid the realm of this pernicious blot?

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: Abbot
line: My lord,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: Abbot
line: Before I freely speak my mind herein,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: Abbot
line: You shall not only take the sacrament

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: Abbot
line: To bury mine intents, but also to effect

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: Abbot
line: Whatever I shall happen to devise.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: Abbot
line: I see your brows are full of discontent,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: Abbot
line: Your hearts of sorrow and your eyes of tears:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: Abbot
line: Come home with me to supper; and I'll lay

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
speaker: Abbot
line: A plot shall show us all a merry day.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: QUEEN
line: This way the king will come; this is the way

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: QUEEN
line: To Julius Caesar's ill-erected tower,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: QUEEN
line: To whose flint bosom my condemned lord

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Is doom'd a prisoner by proud Bolingbroke:

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Here let us rest, if this rebellious earth

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Have any resting for her true king's queen.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: QUEEN
line: But soft, but see, or rather do not see,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: QUEEN
line: My fair rose wither: yet look up, behold,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: QUEEN
line: That you in pity may dissolve to dew,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: QUEEN
line: And wash him fresh again with true-love tears.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Ah, thou, the model where old Troy did stand,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Thou map of honour, thou King Richard's tomb,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: QUEEN
line: And not King Richard; thou most beauteous inn,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Why should hard-favour'd grief be lodged in thee,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: QUEEN
line: When triumph is become an alehouse guest?

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Join not with grief, fair woman, do not so,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To make my end too sudden: learn, good soul,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To think our former state a happy dream;

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: From which awaked, the truth of what we are

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Shows us but this: I am sworn brother, sweet,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To grim Necessity, and he and I

line: Will keep a league till death. Hie thee to France

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line: And cloister thee in some religious house:

line: Our holy lives must win a new world's crown,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Which our profane hours here have stricken down.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: QUEEN
line: What, is my Richard both in shape and mind

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Transform'd and weaken'd? hath Bolingbroke deposed

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Thine intellect? hath he been in thy heart?

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: QUEEN
line: The lion dying thrusteth forth his paw,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: QUEEN
line: And wounds the earth, if nothing else, with rage

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: QUEEN
line: To be o'erpower'd; and wilt thou, pupil-like,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Take thy correction mildly, kiss the rod,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: QUEEN
line: And fawn on rage with base humility,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: QUEEN
line: Which art a lion and a king of beasts?

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: A king of beasts, indeed; if aught but beasts,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: I had been still a happy king of men.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Good sometime queen, prepare thee hence for France:

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Think I am dead and that even here thou takest,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: As from my death-bed, thy last living leave.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: In winter's tedious nights sit by the fire

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: With good old folks and let them tell thee tales

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Of woeful ages long ago betid;

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And ere thou bid good night, to quit their griefs,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Tell thou the lamentable tale of me

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And send the hearers weeping to their beds:

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: For why, the senseless brands will sympathize

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The heavy accent of thy moving tongue

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And in compassion weep the fire out;

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And some will mourn in ashes, some coal-black,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: For the deposing of a rightful king.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: My lord, the mind of Bolingbroke is changed:

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line: You must to Pomfret, not unto the Tower.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: And, madam, there is order ta'en for you;

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: With all swift speed you must away to France.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Northumberland, thou ladder wherewithal

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The mounting Bolingbroke ascends my throne,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The time shall not be many hours of age

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: More than it is ere foul sin gathering head

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Shalt break into corruption: thou shalt think,

line: Though he divide the realm and give thee half,

line: It is too little, helping him to all;

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And he shall think that thou, which know'st the way

speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To plant unrightful kings, wilt know again,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Being ne'er so little urged, another way

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To pluck him headlong from the usurped throne.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line: The love of wicked men converts to fear;

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That fear to hate, and hate turns one or both

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line: To worthy danger and deserved death.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line: Take leave and part; for you must part forthwith.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.
