line: Doubly divorced! Bad men, you violate

line: And then betwixt me and my married wife.

line: Let me unkiss the oath 'twixt thee and me;

line: She came adorned hither like sweet May,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line: Sent back like Hallowmas or short'st of day.

line: Thus give I mine, and thus take I thy heart.

speaker: QUEEN
line: Give me mine own again; 'twere no good part

line: We make woe wanton with this fond delay:

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line: Once more, adieu; the rest let sorrow say.

line: It is a matter of small consequence,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Which for some reasons I would not have seen.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Which for some reasons, sir, I mean to see.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: I fear, I fear,--

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: What should you fear?

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: 'Tis nothing but some bond, that he is enter'd into

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: For gay apparel 'gainst the triumph day.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Bound to himself! what doth he with a bond

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: That he is bound to? Wife, thou art a fool.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Boy, let me see the writing.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: I do beseech you, pardon me; I may not show it.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: I will be satisfied; let me see it, I say.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Treason! foul treason! Villain! traitor! slave!

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: What is the matter, my lord?

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Ho! who is within there?

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Saddle my horse.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: God for his mercy, what treachery is here!

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Why, what is it, my lord?

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Give me my boots, I say; saddle my horse.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Now, by mine honour, by my life, by my troth,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: I will appeach the villain.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: What is the matter?

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Peace, foolish woman.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: I will not peace. What is the matter, Aumerle.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Good mother, be content; it is no more

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Than my poor life must answer.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Thy life answer!

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Bring me my boots: I will unto the king.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Strike him, Aumerle. Poor boy, thou art amazed.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Hence, villain! never more come in my sight.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Give me my boots, I say.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Why, York, what wilt thou do?

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Wilt thou not hide the trespass of thine own?

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Have we more sons? or are we like to have?

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Is not my teeming date drunk up with time?

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: And wilt thou pluck my fair son from mine age,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: And rob me of a happy mother's name?

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Is he not like thee? is he not thine own?

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Thou fond mad woman,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Wilt thou conceal this dark conspiracy?

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: A dozen of them here have ta'en the sacrament,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: And interchangeably set down their hands,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: To kill the king at Oxford.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: He shall be none;

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: We'll keep him here: then what is that to him?

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Away, fond woman! were he twenty times my son,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: I would appeach him.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Hadst thou groan'd for him

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: As I have done, thou wouldst be more pitiful.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: But now I know thy mind; thou dost suspect

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: That I have been disloyal to thy bed,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: And that he is a bastard, not thy son:

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Sweet York, sweet husband, be not of that mind:

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: He is as like thee as a man may be,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Not like to me, or any of my kin,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: And yet I love him.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Make way, unruly woman!

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: After, Aumerle! mount thee upon his horse;

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Spur post, and get before him to the king,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: And beg thy pardon ere he do accuse thee.

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: I'll not be long behind; though I be old,

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: I doubt not but to ride as fast as York:

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: And never will I rise up from the ground

scene: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Till Bolingbroke have pardon'd thee. Away, be gone!

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Can no man tell me of my unthrifty son?

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: 'Tis full three months since I did see him last;

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: If any plague hang over us, 'tis he.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: I would to God, my lords, he might be found:

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Inquire at London, 'mongst the taverns there,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: For there, they say, he daily doth frequent,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: With unrestrained loose companions,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Even such, they say, as stand in narrow lanes,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And beat our watch, and rob our passengers;

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Which he, young wanton and effeminate boy,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Takes on the point of honour to support

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: So dissolute a crew.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: My lord, some two days since I saw the prince,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: And told him of those triumphs held at Oxford.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And what said the gallant?

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: His answer was, he would unto the stews,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: And from the common'st creature pluck a glove,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: And wear it as a favour; and with that

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: He would unhorse the lustiest challenger.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: As dissolute as desperate; yet through both

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: I see some sparks of better hope, which elder years

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: May happily bring forth. But who comes here?

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Where is the king?

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: What means our cousin, that he stares and looks

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: So wildly?

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: God save your grace! I do beseech your majesty,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: To have some conference with your grace alone.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Withdraw yourselves, and leave us here alone.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: What is the matter with our cousin now?

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: For ever may my knees grow to the earth,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: My tongue cleave to my roof within my mouth

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Unless a pardon ere I rise or speak.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Intended or committed was this fault?

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: If on the first, how heinous e'er it be,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: To win thy after-love I pardon thee.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Then give me leave that I may turn the key,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: That no man enter till my tale be done.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Have thy desire.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Within  My liege, beware; look to thyself;

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Thou hast a traitor in thy presence there.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Villain, I'll make thee safe.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Stay thy revengeful hand; thou hast no cause to fear.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Within  Open the door, secure, foolhardy king:

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Shall I for love speak treason to thy face?

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Open the door, or I will break it open.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: What is the matter, uncle? speak;

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Recover breath; tell us how near is danger,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: That we may arm us to encounter it.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Peruse this writing here, and thou shalt know

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: The treason that my haste forbids me show.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Remember, as thou read'st, thy promise pass'd:

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: I do repent me; read not my name there

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: My heart is not confederate with my hand.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: It was, villain, ere thy hand did set it down.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: I tore it from the traitor's bosom, king;

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Fear, and not love, begets his penitence:

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Forget to pity him, lest thy pity prove

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: A serpent that will sting thee to the heart.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: O heinous, strong and bold conspiracy!

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: O loyal father of a treacherous son!

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Thou sheer, immaculate and silver fountain,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: From when this stream through muddy passages

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Hath held his current and defiled himself!

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Thy overflow of good converts to bad,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And thy abundant goodness shall excuse

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: This deadly blot in thy digressing son.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: So shall my virtue be his vice's bawd;

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: And he shall spend mine honour with his shame,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: As thriftless sons their scraping fathers' gold.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Mine honour lives when his dishonour dies,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Or my shamed life in his dishonour lies:

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Thou kill'st me in his life; giving him breath,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: The traitor lives, the true man's put to death.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Within  What ho, my liege! for God's sake,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: let me in.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: What shrill-voiced suppliant makes this eager cry?

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: A woman, and thy aunt, great king; 'tis I.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Speak with me, pity me, open the door.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: A beggar begs that never begg'd before.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Our scene is alter'd from a serious thing,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And now changed to 'The Beggar and the King.'

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: My dangerous cousin, let your mother in:

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: I know she is come to pray for your foul sin.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: If thou do pardon, whosoever pray,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: More sins for this forgiveness prosper may.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: This fester'd joint cut off, the rest rest sound;

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: This let alone will all the rest confound.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: O king, believe not this hard-hearted man!

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Love loving not itself none other can.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Thou frantic woman, what dost thou make here?

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Shall thy old dugs once more a traitor rear?

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Sweet York, be patient. Hear me, gentle liege.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Rise up, good aunt.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Not yet, I thee beseech:

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: For ever will I walk upon my knees,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: And never see day that the happy sees,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Till thou give joy; until thou bid me joy,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: By pardoning Rutland, my transgressing boy.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF AUMERLE
line: Unto my mother's prayers I bend my knee.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Against them both my true joints bended be.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Ill mayst thou thrive, if thou grant any grace!

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Pleads he in earnest? look upon his face;

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: His eyes do drop no tears, his prayers are in jest;

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: His words come from his mouth, ours from our breast:

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: He prays but faintly and would be denied;

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: We pray with heart and soul and all beside:

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: His weary joints would gladly rise, I know;

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Our knees shall kneel till to the ground they grow:

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: His prayers are full of false hypocrisy;

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Ours of true zeal and deep integrity.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Our prayers do out-pray his; then let them have

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: That mercy which true prayer ought to have.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Good aunt, stand up.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Nay, do not say, 'stand up;'

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Say, 'pardon' first, and afterwards 'stand up.'

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: And if I were thy nurse, thy tongue to teach,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: 'Pardon' should be the first word of thy speech.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: I never long'd to hear a word till now;

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Say 'pardon,' king; let pity teach thee how:

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: The word is short, but not so short as sweet;

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: No word like 'pardon' for kings' mouths so meet.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUKE OF YORK
line: Speak it in French, king; say, 'pardonne moi.'

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Dost thou teach pardon pardon to destroy?

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Ah, my sour husband, my hard-hearted lord,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: That set'st the word itself against the word!

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Speak 'pardon' as 'tis current in our land;

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: The chopping French we do not understand.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Thine eye begins to speak; set thy tongue there;

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Or in thy piteous heart plant thou thine ear;

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: That hearing how our plaints and prayers do pierce,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Pity may move thee 'pardon' to rehearse.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Good aunt, stand up.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: I do not sue to stand;

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Pardon is all the suit I have in hand.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: I pardon him, as God shall pardon me.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: O happy vantage of a kneeling knee!

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Yet am I sick for fear: speak it again;

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Twice saying 'pardon' doth not pardon twain,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: But makes one pardon strong.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: With all my heart

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: I pardon him.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: A god on earth thou art.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: But for our trusty brother-in-law and the abbot,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: With all the rest of that consorted crew,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Destruction straight shall dog them at the heels.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Good uncle, help to order several powers

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: To Oxford, or where'er these traitors are:

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: They shall not live within this world, I swear,

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: But I will have them, if I once know where.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Uncle, farewell: and, cousin too, adieu:

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Your mother well hath pray'd, and prove you true.

scene: SCENE III.  A royal palace.
speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK
line: Come, my old son: I pray God make thee new.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: EXTON
line: Didst thou not mark the king, what words he spake,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: EXTON
line: 'Have I no friend will rid me of this living fear?'

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: EXTON
line: Was it not so?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: Servant
line: These were his very words.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: EXTON
line: 'Have I no friend?' quoth he: he spake it twice,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: EXTON
line: And urged it twice together, did he not?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: Servant
line: He did.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: EXTON
line: And speaking it, he wistly look'd on me,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: EXTON
line: And who should say, 'I would thou wert the man'

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: EXTON
line: That would divorce this terror from my heart;'

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: EXTON
line: Meaning the king at Pomfret. Come, let's go:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: EXTON
line: I am the king's friend, and will rid his foe.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: I have been studying how I may compare

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: This prison where I live unto the world:

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And for because the world is populous

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And here is not a creature but myself,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: I cannot do it; yet I'll hammer it out.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: My brain I'll prove the female to my soul,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: My soul the father; and these two beget

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: A generation of still-breeding thoughts,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And these same thoughts people this little world,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: In humours like the people of this world,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: For no thought is contented. The better sort,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: As thoughts of things divine, are intermix'd

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: With scruples and do set the word itself

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Against the word:

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: As thus, 'Come, little ones,' and then again,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: 'It is as hard to come as for a camel

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To thread the postern of a small needle's eye.'

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Thoughts tending to ambition, they do plot

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Unlikely wonders; how these vain weak nails

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: May tear a passage through the flinty ribs

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Of this hard world, my ragged prison walls,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And, for they cannot, die in their own pride.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Thoughts tending to content flatter themselves

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That they are not the first of fortune's slaves,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Nor shall not be the last; like silly beggars

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Who sitting in the stocks refuge their shame,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That many have and others must sit there;

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And in this thought they find a kind of ease,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Bearing their own misfortunes on the back

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Of such as have before endured the like.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Thus play I in one person many people,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And none contented: sometimes am I king;

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Then treasons make me wish myself a beggar,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And so I am: then crushing penury

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Persuades me I was better when a king;

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Then am I king'd again: and by and by

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Think that I am unking'd by Bolingbroke,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And straight am nothing: but whate'er I be,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Nor I nor any man that but man is

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: With nothing shall be pleased, till he be eased

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: With being nothing. Music do I hear?

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Ha, ha! keep time: how sour sweet music is,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: When time is broke and no proportion kept!

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: So is it in the music of men's lives.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And here have I the daintiness of ear

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: To cheque time broke in a disorder'd string;

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: But for the concord of my state and time

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Had not an ear to hear my true time broke.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: I wasted time, and now doth time waste me;

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: For now hath time made me his numbering clock:

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: My thoughts are minutes; and with sighs they jar

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Their watches on unto mine eyes, the outward watch,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Whereto my finger, like a dial's point,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Is pointing still, in cleansing them from tears.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Now sir, the sound that tells what hour it is

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Are clamorous groans, which strike upon my heart,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Which is the bell: so sighs and tears and groans

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Show minutes, times, and hours: but my time

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Runs posting on in Bolingbroke's proud joy,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: While I stand fooling here, his Jack o' the clock.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: This music mads me; let it sound no more;

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: For though it have holp madmen to their wits,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: In me it seems it will make wise men mad.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Yet blessing on his heart that gives it me!

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: For 'tis a sign of love; and love to Richard

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Is a strange brooch in this all-hating world.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: Groom
line: Hail, royal prince!

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Thanks, noble peer;

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The cheapest of us is ten groats too dear.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: What art thou? and how comest thou hither,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Where no man never comes but that sad dog

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That brings me food to make misfortune live?

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: Groom
line: I was a poor groom of thy stable, king,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: Groom
line: When thou wert king; who, travelling towards York,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: Groom
line: With much ado at length have gotten leave

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: Groom
line: To look upon my sometimes royal master's face.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: Groom
line: O, how it yearn'd my heart when I beheld

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: Groom
line: In London streets, that coronation-day,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: Groom
line: When Bolingbroke rode on roan Barbary,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: Groom
line: That horse that thou so often hast bestrid,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: Groom
line: That horse that I so carefully have dress'd!

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Rode he on Barbary? Tell me, gentle friend,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: How went he under him?

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: Groom
line: So proudly as if he disdain'd the ground.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: So proud that Bolingbroke was on his back!

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That jade hath eat bread from my royal hand;

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: This hand hath made him proud with clapping him.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Would he not stumble? would he not fall down,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Since pride must have a fall, and break the neck

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Of that proud man that did usurp his back?

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Forgiveness, horse! why do I rail on thee,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Since thou, created to be awed by man,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Wast born to bear? I was not made a horse;

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: And yet I bear a burthen like an ass,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Spurr'd, gall'd and tired by jouncing Bolingbroke.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: Keeper
line: Fellow, give place; here is no longer stay.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: If thou love me, 'tis time thou wert away.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: Groom
line: What my tongue dares not, that my heart shall say.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: Keeper
line: My lord, will't please you to fall to?

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Taste of it first, as thou art wont to do.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: Keeper
line: My lord, I dare not: Sir Pierce of Exton, who

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: Keeper
line: lately came from the king, commands the contrary.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: The devil take Henry of Lancaster and thee!

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Patience is stale, and I am weary of it.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: Keeper
line: Help, help, help!

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: How now! what means death in this rude assault?

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Villain, thy own hand yields thy death's instrument.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Go thou, and fill another room in hell.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That hand shall burn in never-quenching fire

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: That staggers thus my person. Exton, thy fierce hand

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Hath with the king's blood stain'd the king's own land.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Mount, mount, my soul! thy seat is up on high;

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: KING RICHARD II
line: Whilst my gross flesh sinks downward, here to die.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: EXTON
line: As full of valour as of royal blood:

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: EXTON
line: Both have I spill'd; O would the deed were good!

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: EXTON
line: For now the devil, that told me I did well,

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: EXTON
line: Says that this deed is chronicled in hell.

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: EXTON
line: This dead king to the living king I'll bear

scene: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.
speaker: EXTON
line: Take hence the rest, and give them burial here.

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Kind uncle York, the latest news we hear

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Is that the rebels have consumed with fire

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Our town of Cicester in Gloucestershire;

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: But whether they be ta'en or slain we hear not.

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Welcome, my lord what is the news?

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: First, to thy sacred state wish I all happiness.

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: The next news is, I have to London sent

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: The heads of Oxford, Salisbury, Blunt, and Kent:

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: The manner of their taking may appear

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: At large discoursed in this paper here.

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: We thank thee, gentle Percy, for thy pains;

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And to thy worth will add right worthy gains.

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: My lord, I have from Oxford sent to London

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: The heads of Brocas and Sir Bennet Seely,

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: Two of the dangerous consorted traitors

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER
line: That sought at Oxford thy dire overthrow.

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Thy pains, Fitzwater, shall not be forgot;

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Right noble is thy merit, well I wot.

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: The grand conspirator, Abbot of Westminster,

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: With clog of conscience and sour melancholy

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: Hath yielded up his body to the grave;

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: But here is Carlisle living, to abide

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY PERCY
line: Thy kingly doom and sentence of his pride.

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Carlisle, this is your doom:

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Choose out some secret place, some reverend room,

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: More than thou hast, and with it joy thy life;

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: So as thou livest in peace, die free from strife:

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: For though mine enemy thou hast ever been,

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: High sparks of honour in thee have I seen.

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: EXTON
line: Great king, within this coffin I present

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: EXTON
line: Thy buried fear: herein all breathless lies

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: EXTON
line: The mightiest of thy greatest enemies,

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: EXTON
line: Richard of Bordeaux, by me hither brought.

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Exton, I thank thee not; for thou hast wrought

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: A deed of slander with thy fatal hand

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Upon my head and all this famous land.

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: EXTON
line: From your own mouth, my lord, did I this deed.

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: They love not poison that do poison need,

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Nor do I thee: though I did wish him dead,

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: I hate the murderer, love him murdered.

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: The guilt of conscience take thou for thy labour,

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: But neither my good word nor princely favour:

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: With Cain go wander through shades of night,

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And never show thy head by day nor light.

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Lords, I protest, my soul is full of woe,

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: That blood should sprinkle me to make me grow:

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: Come, mourn with me for that I do lament,

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: And put on sullen black incontinent:

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: I'll make a voyage to the Holy Land,

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: To wash this blood off from my guilty hand:

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: March sadly after; grace my mournings here;

scene: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
line: In weeping after this untimely bier.
